sentence: The founding document of the government of Alabama is the Alabama Constitution, which was ratified in 1901.

name: alabama
sentence: With nearly 800 amendments and 310,000 words, it is, according to some, the longest constitution in the world and represents about 40 times the duration of the United States Constitution.

name: alabama
sentence: There has been an important movement to rewrite and modernize the Alabama constitution.

name: alabama
sentence: Critics argue that the constitution of Alabama maintains a highly centralized power with the legislative power of the state, leaving virtually no power in local hands.

name: alabama
sentence: Most counties don't have the home rule.

name: alabama
sentence: Any proposed policy change in the various areas of the State must be approved by the entire Alabama legislature and, often, by state referendum.

name: alabama
sentence: A critique of the current constitution asserts that its complexity and length intentionally codifies segregation and racism.

name: alabama
sentence: The government of Alabama is divided into three coequal branches.

name: alabama
sentence: Legislative power is the Legislative Assembly of Alabama, a bicameral assembly composed of the House of Representatives of Alabama, composed of 105 members, and the Senator of Alabama, composed of 35 members.

name: alabama
sentence: The Legislature is responsible for writing, discussing, adopting or rejecting the laws of the State.

name: alabama
sentence: The Republican Party currently holds a majority in both houses of the legislature.

name: alabama
sentence: The Legislature has the power to derogate from a right of veto by a simple majority (most state legislatures need a two-thirds majority in order to derogate from a right of veto).

name: alabama
sentence: Until 1964, the state elected Senators of State on a geographical basis per county, with one per county.

name: alabama
sentence: Since the adoption of its constitution in 1901, it has not redistributed Congressional constituencies; as a result, urbanized areas are largely underrepresented.

name: alabama
sentence: Nor has it changed the legislative districts to reflect the 10-year censuses.

name: alabama
sentence: In Reynolds v. Sims (1964), the U.S. Supreme Court implemented the principle of "one man, one voice", ruling that Congressional districts should be recomposed on the basis of censuses (as the state had already included in its constitution but had not done).

name: alabama
sentence: In addition, the Court decided that the two chambers of the legislatures of bicameral States should be distributed by population, as there was no constitutional basis for States to have geographical systems.

name: alabama
sentence: At that time, Alabama and many other States had to change their legislative districts, as many countries had systems that were underrepresented in urban areas and districts.

name: alabama
sentence: This has led to decades of under-investment in these areas.

name: alabama
sentence: For example, taxes in Birmingham and Jefferson County provided one third of the state budget, but Jefferson County received only 1/67th of the state's funding.

name: alabama
sentence: Through legislative delegations, the Alabama Legislative Assembly has maintained control of county governments.

name: alabama
sentence: The executive branch is responsible for the enforcement and oversight of laws.

name: alabama
sentence: It is headed by the Governor of Alabama.

name: alabama
sentence: Other members of the Executive include the Cabinet, the Lieutenant Governor of Alabama, the Attorney-General of Alabama, the Secretary of State of Alabama, the Treasurer of Alabama State and the Auditor of Alabama.

sentence: The present governor is Republican Kay Ivey.

sentence: Members of the Legislature take office immediately after the November elections.

name: alabama
sentence: State officials, such as the Governor, the Lieutenant Governor, the Attorney General and other constitutional officials, took office the following January.

sentence: Alabama collects a tax of 2, 4 or 5% on personal income, depending on the amount earned and production status.

name: alabama
sentence: Taxpayers are allowed to deduct their federal income tax from their Alabama state tax, even if they take the standard deduction; those who include it can also deduct the FICA tax (social security tax and health insurance).

name: alabama

sentence: Sales tax rates for towns and counties are also added to purchases.

sentence: In 1999, sales and excise taxes in Alabama accounted for 51 per cent of all government and local revenues, compared to an average of about 36 per cent nationally.

sentence: Alabama's income tax on working poor families is one of the highest in the United States, Alabama, the only state to levy income tax on a family of four whose income does not exceed $4,600, or just a quarter of the federal poverty line.

sentence: There are 67 counties in Alabama.

sentence: Due to the constraints of the Alabama Constitution, which centralizes power within the state's legislative power, only seven counties (Jefferson, Lee, Mobile, Madison, Montgomery, Shelby and Tuscaloosa) in the state have a limited domestic regime.

sentence: Instead, most state counties must press the local Legislative Committee of the State Legislative Assembly for approval of simple local policies, ranging from waste disposal to land use zoning.

sentence: The State Legislative Assembly retained power over local governments by refusing to adopt a constitutional amendment establishing the county system of origin, as recommended by the Alabama Constitutional Commission of 1973.

sentence: The decisions of the United States Supreme Court in Baker v. Carr (1964) required both houses to have population-based districts and redistributed after each census, in order to apply the principle of "one man, one voice".

sentence: The constitution of Alabama has been amended more than 700 times, and nearly a third of the amendments are local in nature, applying only to one county or city.

sentence: In 1874, the political coalition of white democrats known as Redemptors took control of the government of the state of republicans, in part by suppressing the black vote through violence, fraud and intimidation.

name: alabama
sentence: After 1890, a coalition of white democratic politicians passed laws to separate and deprive African-American residents, a process completed in the provisions of the 1901 constitution.

name: alabama
sentence: The provisions that deny blacks the right to vote have led to the exclusion of many poor whites.

sentence: In 1941, more whites than blacks had been deprived of their rights: from 600,000 to 520,000.

sentence: The total effects have been greater for the black community, as almost all of its citizens have been deprived of their rights and have been relegated to separate and unequal treatment under the law.

name: alabama
sentence: From 1901 to 1960, the state did not redraw electoral districts as the population increased and moved within the state during the urbanization and industrialization of certain regions.

name: alabama

name: arizona
sentence: Phoenix became the official state capital with Arizona's admission to the union in 1912.

name: arizona
sentence: The House of Representatives and Senators' Buildings were dedicated in 1960, and a building of the Executive Office was dedicated in 1974 (the ninth floor of this building is the place where the Office of the Governor is located).

name: arizona
sentence: The original Capitol building has been converted into a museum.

name: arizona
sentence: The Capitol complex is dominated and highlighted by the rich Wesley Bolin Memorial Plaza landscape, named after Wesley Bolin, a governor who died in office in the 1970s.

name: arizona
sentence: The site also includes numerous monuments and memorials, including the anchor and signal mast of the USARIZona (one of the U.S. Navy ships sunk in Pearl Harbor) and a granite version of the Ten Commandments.

name: arizona
sentence: The Arizona Legislature is bicameral (like the Legislature of all other states except Nebraska) and consists of a 30-member Senator and a 60-member House of Representatives.

name: arizona
sentence: Each of the 30 legislative districts has one senator and two representatives.

name: arizona
sentence: The legislators are elected for two-year terms.

name: arizona
sentence: Each legislature covers a period of two years.

name: arizona
sentence: The first session following the general election is known as the first regular session, and the second regular session is known as the second regular session.

name: arizona
sentence: Each ordinary session shall begin on the second Monday in January and shall adjourn sine die (duration for the year) no later than the Saturday of the week in which the hundredth day from the beginning of the ordinary session falls.

name: arizona
sentence: The Speaker of the Senate and Speaker of the House, by regulation, may extend the session for up to seven additional days.

name: arizona
sentence: Thereafter, the session may be extended only by a majority vote of the members present in each Chamber.

name: arizona
sentence: The majority party is the Republican Party, which has held power in both chambers since 1993.

name: arizona
sentence: The Democratic Party won several legislative seats in the Arizona Chamber of State, bringing Democratic leader Charlene Fernandez a seat away from a majority (31-29).

name: arizona
sentence: Senators and representatives of the states of Arizona are elected for a two-year term and are limited to four consecutive terms in a chamber, although there is no limit to the total number of terms.

name: arizona
sentence: When a legislator is limited to a term of office, it is common for him or her to run for election to the other House.

name: arizona
sentence: The General Fund budget for 2006-2007, approved by the Arizona Legislative Assembly in June 2006, was slightly less than $10 billion.

name: arizona
sentence: In addition to the money spent on government agencies, it also included over $500 million in property and income tax reductions, salary increases for government employees, and additional funding for the K-12 education system.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona's executive branch is headed by a Governor, who is elected for a four-year term.

name: arizona
sentence: The Governor may fill a number of warrants, but not more than two in a row.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is one of the few states that has no governor's mansion.

name: arizona
sentence: During their term of office, the governors reside in their private residence, with executive offices located in the executive tower of the state capitol.

name: arizona
sentence: Doug Ducey (R) is the governor of Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: Governor Jan Brewer took office in 2009 after Janet Napolitano was appointed by Barack Obama to the position of Secretary of Homeland Security confirmed by the United States Senator.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona has four women governors, more than any other state.

name: arizona
sentence: The Secretary of State, the Treasurer of the State, the Attorney-General of the State, the Director of Public Investigation, the State Inspector of Mines and a Commission of five members of society are also elected.

name: arizona
sentence: All elected representatives have a four-year term of office and are limited to two consecutive terms (with the exception of the Office of the State Inspector of Mines, which is limited to four terms).

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is one of five states that do not have a lieutenant governor.

name: arizona
sentence: The Secretary of State elected is first on-line to succeed the Governor in the event of death, disability, resignation or revocation.

name: arizona
sentence: If appointed, the Secretary of State is not eligible and the next Governor is selected from the next eligible public servant on the line of succession, including the Attorney General, Treasurer of State and Superintendent of Public Instruction.

name: arizona
sentence: Since 1977, four Secretaries of State and a Attorney General have succeeded the position of Governor of Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: The Arizona Supreme Court is the highest court in Arizona, composed of a Chief Justice, a Vice-President of Justice and five Associate Judges.

name: arizona
sentence: Judges are appointed by the Governor from a list recommended by a bipartite commission and must be retained by election after the first two years of appointment.

name: arizona
sentence: Subsequently, elections are held every six years.

name: arizona
sentence: The Supreme Court has jurisdiction on appeal in death penalty cases, but almost all other appeal cases go first to the Arizona Court of Appeal.

name: arizona
sentence: The court has initial jurisdiction in a few other circumstances, as set out in the Constitution of the State.

name: arizona
sentence: The court may declare unconstitutional laws if they are based in a bank.

name: arizona
sentence: The court meets in the Arizona Supreme Court building at the Capitol Complex (at the south end of Wesley Bolin Plaza).

name: arizona
sentence: The Arizona Court of Appeal, divided into two chambers, is the State Intermediate Court.

name: arizona
sentence: The first division is based in Phoenix, is composed of sixteen judges, and has jurisdiction in the western and northern regions of the state, as well as in the greater Phoenix area.

name: arizona
sentence: Division 2 is based in Tucson, is composed of six judges and has jurisdiction over the southern regions of the state, including the Tucson region.

name: arizona
sentence: Judges are chosen according to a method similar to that used for judges in the supreme courts of the State.

name: arizona
sentence: Each county in Arizona has a superior court, the size and organization of which are varied and generally dependent on the size of the county.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is divided into 15 counties, ranging in size from 3,210 square kilometres to 48,330 square kilometres.

name: arizona
sentence: The two senators from Arizona are Kyrsten Sinema (D) and Mark Kelly (D).

sentence: Kelly succeeds Martha McSally, who was appointed by Governor Doug Ducey following the resignation of Jon Kyl, who was appointed by Ducey after John McCain's death at the end of 2018.

name: arizona

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona obtained a ninth seat in the House of Representatives as a result of a redistribution based on the 2010 census.

name: arizona
sentence: From statehood to the late 1940s, Arizona was dominated mainly by the Democratic Party.

name: arizona
sentence: During this period, the Democratic presidential candidate carried the state each election, the only exceptions being the 1920, 1924 and 1928 elections – the three were national republican landslides.

name: arizona
sentence: In 1924, Congress had passed a law granting citizenship and suffrage to all Amerindians, some of whom had already been excluded as tribal members on reserve.

name: arizona
sentence: The legal interpretations of the Arizona constitution prohibited Amerindians living on the reserve of voting, classifying them under "trust."

name: arizona
sentence: This interpretation was quashed as incorrect and unconstitutional in 1948 by the Arizona Supreme Court, following an action brought by Frank Harrison and Harry Austin, World War II Indian veterans, both of the Yavapai Nation of Fort McDowell.

name: arizona
sentence: The most important case is Harrison and Austin v. Laveen.

name: arizona
sentence: After the men were denied the opportunity to register in Maricopa County, they sued the registrar.

name: arizona
sentence: The National Congress of American Indians, the Ministry of Justice, the Ministry of the Interior and the American Civil Liberties Union all filed amicus curiae (court friends) briefs in the case.

name: arizona
sentence: The Supreme Court of the State established the rights of Amerindians to vote in the State; at that time they represented about 11 per cent of the population.

name: arizona
sentence: That year, a similar provision was overturned in New Mexico when another Indian veteran was challenged in court.

name: arizona
sentence: They were the only two States that continued to prohibit Amerindians from voting.

name: arizona
sentence: From the election of Dwight D. Eisenhower in 1952 until 2020, the majority of state voters favored Republicans in the presidential elections.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona voted Republican in every presidential election from 1952 to 1992, with Richard Nixon and Ronald Reagan winning the state particularly big margins.

name: arizona
sentence: During this period of forty years, it was the only state not to be carried by a democrat at least once.

name: arizona
sentence: Democrat Lyndon Johnson, in 1964, lost the state by less than 5,000 votes against the Arizona senator Barry Goldwater.

name: arizona
sentence: (This was the most strongly contested state in what otherwise was a shaken victory for Johnson that year.)

name: arizona
sentence: Democrat Bill Clinton ended this series in 1996, when he won Arizona by just over two percentage points (Clinton had previously won less than two percent of Arizona's electoral vote in 1992).

name: arizona
sentence: From 2000 to 2016, the majority of the state continued to support Republican presidential candidates through strong margins.

name: arizona
sentence: In the 2020 presidential election in the United States, Joe Biden once again broke the trend by becoming the first democratic presidential candidate to win Arizona since 1996.

name: arizona
sentence: Since the end of the 20th century, the Republican Party has also dominated Arizona politics in general.

name: arizona
sentence: The rapidly growing suburbs of Phoenix and Tucson have become increasingly friendly with the Republicans since the 1950s.

name: arizona
sentence: During this period, many "Pinto Democrats", or conservative democrats in rural areas, became more and more willing to support Republicans at state and national level.

name: arizona
sentence: While the state normally supports republicans at the federal level, democrats are often competitive in state-wide elections.

name: arizona
sentence: Two of the last six governors have been Democrats.

name: arizona
sentence: On March 4, 2008, Senator John McCain passed the Republican nomination for 2008, becoming the first presidential candidate since Barry Goldwater in 1964.

name: arizona
sentence: Policy in Arizona is dominated by a long-standing rivalry between its two largest counties, Maricopa and Pima, which are home to Phoenix and Tucson, respectively.

name: arizona
sentence: Both counties have nearly 75 per cent of the state's population and have obtained nearly 80 per cent of the state's vote.

name: arizona
sentence: They also elect a substantial majority of the State legislature.

name: arizona
sentence: Maricopa County is home to almost 60% of the state's population, and most of the state's elected officials live there.

name: arizona
sentence: Before Joe Biden won Maricopa County in 2020, he had voted republican in all presidential elections since 1948.

name: arizona
sentence: This included the 1964 race of indigenous son Barry Goldwater; he would not have worn his original condition without his margin of 20,000 votes in Maricopa County.

name: arizona
sentence: Similarly, while McCain won Arizona by eight percentage points in 2008, he enjoyed his 130,000-vote margin in Maricopa County.

name: arizona
sentence: On the other hand, Pima County, home to Tucson, and most of southern Arizona have always voted more democraticly.

name: arizona
sentence: While the suburb of Tucson lean republican, they hold a somewhat more moderate mark of republicanism than what is common in the Phoenix region.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona rejected the ban on same-sex marriage in a referendum in the 2006 elections.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona was the nation's first state to do so.

name: arizona
sentence: Same-sex marriage was not recognized in Arizona, but this amendment would have denied legal or financial benefits to unmarried homosexual or heterosexual couples.

name: arizona
sentence: In 2008, Arizona voters adopted proposal 102, an amendment to the state constitution to define marriage as a union of a man and a woman.

name: arizona
sentence: It has been adopted by a narrower majority than similar votes in a number of other States.

name: arizona
sentence: In 2010, Arizona adopted SB 1070, the country's most severe illegal immigration legislation.

name: arizona
sentence: A heated debate broke out between supporters and detractors of the law.

name: arizona
sentence: The U.S. Supreme Court heard the arguments of March 18, 2013, regarding the validity of the Arizona Act, which requires individuals to submit documents proving U.S. citizenship in order to register to vote in national elections.

name: arizona
sentence: The 2018 West Virginia Teachers' Strike inspired teachers in other states, including Arizona, to take similar steps.

name: arizona
sentence: In 2006, Arizona became the first state in the United States to reject a proposal, Prop 107, which allegedly prohibited same-sex marriage and civil unions.

name: arizona
sentence: However, in 2008, Arizona voters approved section 102, a constitutional amendment prohibiting same-sex marriage, but not other unions.

name: arizona
sentence: Before same-sex marriage was legal, the city of Bisbee became the first jurisdiction in Arizona to approve civil unions.

name: arizona
sentence: The State Attorney General at the time, Tom Horne, threatened to prosecute, but cancelled the threat once Bisbee amended the order; Bisbee approved civil unions in 2013.

name: arizona
sentence: The municipalities of Clarkdale, Cottonwood, Jérôme, Sedona and Tucson also had civil unions.

name: arizona
sentence: A November 2011 public policy survey revealed that 44 per cent of Arizona voters supported the legalization of same-sex marriage, while 45 per cent opposed it and 12 per cent were not sure.

name: arizona
sentence: Another question from the same survey revealed that 72% of respondents supported the legal recognition of same-sex couples, 40% supported same-sex marriage, 32% supported civil unions, 27% opposed legal recognition and 1% were unsure.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona's proposal 102, known by its supporters as the Marriage Protection Amendment, appeared as a constitutional amendment cited by law in the November 4, 2008, Arizona election, where it was approved: 56.2% to 43%.

name: arizona
sentence: It amended the Arizona Constitution to define a marriage between a man and a woman.

name: arizona
sentence: On October 17, 2014, Arizona Attorney General Tom Horne announced that his office would no longer oppose same-sex marriage in response to a U.S. District Court decision on Arizona Proposal 102.

name: arizona
sentence: On that day, the clerk of each County of the Superior Court began issuing same-sex marriage permits, and Arizona became the 31st state to legalize same-sex marriage.

name: arizona
sentence: In Arizona, public schools are divided into some 220 local school districts that operate independently but are in most cases governed by elected county principals, who in turn are overseen by the Arizona National Education Council and the Arizona Department of Education.

name: arizona
sentence: The Phoenix Art Museum, located on the historic corridor of Phoenix's Central Avenue, is the world's largest collection of visual art.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas () is a state in the south-central United States with more than three million people in 2018.

name: arkansas
sentence: His name is from the language of the Osage, from the Siwan diversion; he has designated their related relative, the Quapaw people.

name: arkansas
sentence: The varied geography of the state extends from the mountainous regions of the Ozark and Ouachita Mountains, which make up the United States.

name: arkansas
sentence: The inner Highlands, to the densely wooded lands in the south called the Arkansas Timberlands, to the eastern lowlands along the Mississippi and Arkansas Delta.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is the 29th largest by region and the 33rd most populous American state.

name: arkansas
sentence: The capital and most populated city is Little Rock, in the central part of the state, a hub of transportation, business, culture and government.

name: arkansas
sentence: The northwest corner of the state, including the Fayetteville–Springdale–Rogers metropolitan area and the Fort Smith metropolitan area, is a centre of population, education and economics.

name: arkansas
sentence: The territory of Arkansas was admitted to the Union as the 25th State on 15 June 1836.

name: arkansas
sentence: Much of the delta has been developed for cotton plantations, and landowners depend largely on the enslaved work of African-Americans.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 1861 the Arkansas seceded from the United States and joined the Confederate States of America during the civil war.

name: arkansas
sentence: Upon its return to the Union in 1868, Arkansas continued to suffer because of its dependence on the economy of large plantations.

name: arkansas
sentence: Cotton has remained the first commodity crop, although the cotton market has declined.

name: arkansas
sentence: Because farmers and businessmen were not diversifying and there was little industrial investment, the state was lagging behind in the economic outlook.

name: arkansas
sentence: White rural interests dominated Arkansas politics by depriving African Americans of their right to vote and refusing to renew the legislative power.

name: arkansas
sentence: It was only after the civil rights movement and federal intervention that more African Americans were able to vote.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Supreme Court reversed rural domination in the South and other states that had refused to renew their state legislatures, or retained rules based on geographical districts.

name: arkansas
sentence: In a man's historic decision, a voice, she said that states had to organize their legislatures by districts with roughly equal populations, and that they had to be redefined as needed after the census of each decade.

name: arkansas
sentence: After the Second World War, Arkansas began to diversify its economy.

name: arkansas
sentence: In the 21st century, its economy was based on service industries, aviation, poultry, steel and tourism, as well as important commodity crops such as cotton, soybeans and rice.

D. Wright and physicist William L. McMillan, pioneer of supraconductor research.

sentence: It comes from a French term, Arcansas, their plural term for their transliteration of akansa, an Algonquian term for the Quapaw people.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas borders Louisiana to the south, Texas to the southwest, Oklahoma to the west, Missouri to the north, Tennessee and Mississippi to the east.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Arkansas can generally be divided into two halves, the highlands in the northwest and the lowlands in the southeast.

From his deathbed, he ordered his men to massacre all the men of the nearby village of Anilco, whom he feared having plotted with a powerful politeness on the Mississippi River, Quigualtam.

sentence: The climate of the eastern plains is semi-arid (Köppen Climate Classification: BSk) with low humidity and moderate precipitation, usually 15 to 25 inches (380 to 640 millimetres) per year.

name: colorado
sentence: The area is known for its abundant sun and cool and light nights, giving this area a large range of average daytime temperature.

name: colorado
sentence: The difference between the highs of the days and the lows of the nights can be considerable because the heat dissipates in the space during the clear nights, the heat radiation being not trapped by the clouds.

name: colorado
sentence: The Front Range urban corridor, home to most of Colorado's population, is in a shadow of heavy rainfall as it lies on the lee side of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In summer, this region can have many days above 95°F (35°C) and often 100°F (38°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Low winter temperatures in the plains typically range from 25 to -10°F (−4 to -23°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 75% of precipitation occurs during the growing season, from April to September, but this region is highly drought-prone.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of the precipitation comes from thunderstorms, which can be severe, and large snowstorms that occur in winter and early spring.

name: colorado
sentence: Otherwise, the winters tend to be more or less dry and cold.

name: colorado
sentence: In most of the region, March is the most snowy month.

name: colorado
sentence: April and May are usually the wettest months, while April is the wettest month overall.

name: colorado
sentence: The cities of Front Range closer to the mountains tend to be warmer in winter due to Chinook winds that warm the area, sometimes bringing temperatures of 70°F (21°C) or higher in winter.

name: colorado
sentence: The average temperature for July is 55 °F (13 °C) in the morning and 90 °F (32 °C) in the afternoon.

name: colorado
sentence: The average January temperature is 18°F (−8°C) in the morning and 48°F (9°C) in the afternoon, although the variation between consecutive days may be 40°F (20°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Just west of the plains and in the foothills, there are a wide variety of climate types.

name: colorado
sentence: Locations a few kilometres apart can experience a completely different time depending on the topography.

name: colorado
sentence: Most valleys have a semi-arid climate, which is not the case with the eastern plains, which move to an alpine climate at the highest altitudes.

name: colorado
sentence: Microclimates also exist in local areas that cover almost the full range of climates, including subtropical highlands (Cfb/Cwb), wet subtropicals (Cfa), wet continentals (Dfa/Dfb), Mediterraneans (Csa/Csb) and subarctics (Dfc).

name: colorado
sentence: Extreme climate change is common in Colorado, although a significant portion of extreme weather change occurs in the less populated areas of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Storms are common east of the continental ditch in the spring and summer, but are usually short.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is a common view in the mountains east of the Divide and across the eastern plains, especially the northeastern part of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is the most frequently reported serious weather hazard in the warm season, sometimes causing human injury, as well as significant damage to property.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are prone to some of the largest hailstorms in North America.

name: colorado
sentence: An example is the violent hailstorms that struck Denver on July 11, 1990 and May 8, 2017, the latter being the most costly in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are part of the extreme west of the Tornado gangway; some harmful tornadoes on the eastern plains include the 1990 Limon F3 tornado and the 2008 Windsor EF3 tornado, which devastated the small town.

name: colorado
sentence: Portions of the eastern plains see particularly frequent tornadoes, whether from mesocyclones in supercell storms or from less intense tillages, as in the Denver convergence vorticity zone (DCVZ).

name: colorado
sentence: The plains are also exposed to occasional flooding and particularly severe flash floods, which are caused by both thunderstorms and the rapid melting of snow in the mountains during warm weather.

name: colorado
sentence: Notable examples include the Denver flood in 1965, the Big Thompson flood in 1976, and the Colorado flood in 2013.

name: colorado
sentence: Hot weather is common during the summers in Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The city's record in 1901 for consecutive days above 90°F (32°C) was broken in the summer of 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: The new record of 24 consecutive days surpassed the previous record by almost a week.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of Colorado is very dry, with the average condition only 17 inches (430 millimetres) of precipitation per year on a state-wide basis.

name: colorado
sentence: The state rarely goes through a period when part of it is not to some extent drought.

name: colorado
sentence: The lack of precipitation contributes to the severity of forest fires in the state, such as the late Hayman of 2002.

name: colorado
sentence: Other notable fires include the 2010 Fourmile Canyon Fire, the Waldo Canyon Fire, and the June 2012 High Park Fire, and the June 2013 Black Forest Fire.

name: colorado
sentence: Even these fires were overtaken by the pine mulch fire, Cameron Peak's fire, and the Eastern Disturbation Fire in 2020, all of which are the three largest fires in Colorado history (see Colorado Forest Fires in 2020).

name: colorado
sentence: However, some of Colorado's mountainous regions receive a large amount of moisture from winter snowfall.

name: colorado
sentence: Spring melting of these snows often causes high water flows in the Yampa River, Colorado, Rio Grande, Arkansas, North Platte River and South Platte River.

name: colorado
sentence: Water flowing from the Colorado Rocky Mountains is a very important source of water for farms, towns and cities in the southwestern states of New Mexico, Arizona, Utah and Nevada, as well as for the Midwest, such as Nebraska and Kansas, and the southern states of Oklahoma and Texas.

name: colorado
sentence: A significant amount of water is also diverted for use in California; from time to time (formerly naturally and regularly), water flows reach northern Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest official ambient air temperature ever recorded in Colorado was 115°F (46.1°C) on July 20, 2019, at the John Martin Dam.

name: colorado
sentence: The lowest official air temperature was −61°F (−51.7°C) on 1 February 1985 in Maybell.

name: colorado
sentence: Despite its mountainous relief, Colorado is relatively calm on the seismic plane.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. National Earthquake Information Centre is located in Golden.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 22, 2011, an earthquake of magnitude 5.3 occurred 14 kilometres west and southwest of the city of Trinidad.

name: colorado
sentence: There were no casualties and only a small number of damage was reported.

name: colorado
sentence: It was the second largest earthquake in Colorado's history.

name: colorado
sentence: A magnitude 5.7 earthquake was recorded in 1973.

name: colorado
sentence: In the early morning of August 24, 2018, four minor earthquakes caught up with Colorado from magnitude 2.9 to 4.3.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has recorded 525 earthquakes since 1973, with a majority of 2 to 3.5 on the Richter scale.

name: colorado
sentence: The area that is now the state of Colorado has been inhabited by Native Americans for over 13,000 years.

name: colorado
sentence: The Lindenmeier site in Larimer County contains artifacts dating from approximately 11200 BC to 3000 BC.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern limit of the Rockies was an important migratory route that was important for the spread of the first peoples throughout the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The former Pueblo people lived in the valleys and mesas of the Colorado plateau.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute Nation has inhabited the valleys of the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Western Rocky Mountains, even east of the Front Range these days.

name: colorado
sentence: The Apaches and Comanches also lived in the eastern and southeastern parts of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Sometimes the Arapaho Nation and the Cheyenne Nation moved westward to hunt through the High Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Spanish Empire claimed Colorado as part of its province in New Mexico before the United States became involved in the region.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States acquired a land claim to the east of the Rocky Mountains with the purchase of Louisiana from France in 1803.

name: colorado
sentence: This American claim contradicts Spain's claim to the upper Arkansas basin as the exclusive commercial area of its colony of Santa Fé de Nuevo México.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1806, Zebulon Pike led an American army reconnaissance expedition to the disputed area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Pike and his men were arrested by Spanish riders in the San Luis Valley the following February, taken to Chihuahua and expelled from Mexico the following July.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States has waived its rights to all lands south and west of Arkansas and south of the 42nd parallel north and west of the 100th meridian to the west as part of the purchase of Florida from Spain under the Adams-Onís Treaty of 1819.

name: colorado
sentence: The Treaty entered into force on 22 February 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Having established its border with Spain, the United States admitted to the Union the south-eastern part of the territory of Missouri as the state of Missouri on 10 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: The rest of Missouri territory, including what will become north-eastern Colorado, became unorganized territory and remained unorganized for 33 years on the issue of slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: After 11 years of war, Spain finally recognized Mexico's independence with the treaty of Cordoba signed on 24 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico finally ratified the Adams-Onís treaty in 1831.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texas revolt of 1835–36 fomented a dispute between the United States and Mexico, which finally broke out in the war between Mexico and America in 1846.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico ceded its northern territory to the United States with the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo at the end of the war in 1848.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of the American settlers traveling west to Oregon, the new California gold fields, or the new Mormon colonies of Deseret State in the Salt Lake Valley, avoided the rugged southern rocky mountains, and instead followed the North Platte River and Sweetwater River to South Pass (Wyoming), the lowest passage of the continental divide between the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Central Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1849, the Mormons of the Salt Lake Valley organized the extra-legal state of Deseret, claiming the entire Great Basin and all the lands drained by the Green, Grand and Colorado rivers.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. federal government totally refused to recognize the new Mormon government because it was theocratic and sanctioned plural marriage.

name: colorado
sentence: Instead, the 1850 compromise divided the Mexican Cessation and the claims of northwestern Texas into a new state and two new territories, the State of California, the territory of New Mexico and the territory of Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 9, 1851, American Mexican settlers from the Taos region settled in the village of San Luis and then in the New Mexico Territory, later becoming the first permanent Euro-American colony in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1854, Senator Stephen A. Douglas persuaded the American Congress to divide the unorganized territory east of the Continental Divide into two new organized territories, Kansas Territory and Nebraska Territory, and an unorganized southern region known as Indian Territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Each new territory had to decide the fate of slavery within its borders, but this compromise only fueled the animosity between the free ground and the pro-slavery factions.

name: colorado
sentence: Gold seekers organized the provisional government of Jefferson's territory on August 24, 1859, but the new territory did not obtain the approval of the United States Congress in the debate on slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: The election of Abraham Lincoln as President of the United States on 6 November 1860 led to the secession of nine southern slave states and the threat of civil war between states.

name: colorado
sentence: In an effort to increase the political power of the states of the Union, the Congress, dominated by the Republican Party, quickly admitted the eastern part of Kansas territory to the Union as a free state of Kansas on 29 January 1861, leaving the western part of Kansas territory, and its gold mining areas, as unorganized territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Thirty days later, on February 28, 1861, the outgoing president of the United States, James Buchanan, signed a convention act organizing the free territory of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The initial limits of Colorado remain unchanged, with the exception of changes to government surveys.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado name was chosen because it was commonly believed that the Colorado River was native to the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1776, the Spanish priest Silvestre Vélez de Escalante reported that the Amerindians of the region knew the river as Rio Colorado for the red brown silt that the river carried mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1859, a topographical expedition of the American army led by Captain John Macorb established the confluence of the Green River with the Grand River in what is now Canyonlands National Park in Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: The Macomb party has designated the confluence as the source of the Colorado River.

name: colorado
sentence: On 12 April 1861, South Carolina artillery opened fire on Fort Sumter to trigger the American civil war.

name: colorado
sentence: While many gold lovers liked Confederation, the vast majority remained fiercely loyal to the cause of the Union.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1862, a cavalry force from Texas invaded the territory of New Mexico and captured Santa Fe on 10 March.

name: colorado
sentence: The purpose of this western campaign was to seize or disrupt the gold fields of Colorado and California and seize ports of the Pacific Ocean for Confederation.

name: colorado
sentence: A force hastily organized by Colorado volunteers moved from Denver City, Colorado Territory, to Glorieta Pass, New Mexico Territory, to block the Texans.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 28, New Mexico's Coloradans and local volunteers stopped the Texans at the battle of Col Glorieta, destroyed their cannons and supply carts, and dispersed 500 of their horses and mules.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texans were forced to retire to Santa Fe.

name: colorado
sentence: Having lost the supplies for their campaign and found little support for New Mexico, the Texans abandoned Santa Fe and returned to San Antonio in defeat.

name: colorado
sentence: The Confederation made no other attempt to seize the United States of the Southwest.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1864, territorial governor John Evans appointed the Reverend John Chivington as colonel of Colorado volunteers with orders to protect white settlers of Cheyenne and Arapaho warriors accused of cattle theft.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Chivington directed his men to attack a band of Cheyenne and Arapaho camped along Sand Creek.

name: colorado
sentence: Chivington reports that his troops killed over 500 warriors.

name: colorado
sentence: The militia returned to Denver City in triumph, but several officers reported that the so-called battle was a flagrant massacre of Indians at peace, that most of the deaths were women and children, and that the bodies of the dead had been brutally mutilated and desecrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Army investigations have condemned the action, and new President Andrew Johnson has asked Governor Evans for his resignation, but none of the perpetrators have ever been punished.

name: colorado
sentence: This event is now known as the Sand Creek massacre.

name: colorado
sentence: In the middle of and after the civil war, many discouraged prospectors returned home, but some stayed and developed mines, mills, farms, ranches, roads and towns in Colorado territory.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 14, 1864, James Huff discovered silver near the Col d'Argentine, the first of a multitude of silver strikes.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1867, the Union Pacific railway laid its tracks west to Weir, now Julesburg, in the northeast corner of the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: The Pacific Union established a link with the Central Pacific Railway at the Promontory Summit in Utah on 10 May 1869 to form the first Transcontinental Railway.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver Pacific railway arrived in Denver in June of the following year, and the Kansas Pacific arrived two months later to forge the second line across the continent.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1872 rich veins of silver were discovered in the San Juan Mountains on the Ute Indian Reserve in southwestern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute people were withdrawn from the San Juans the following year.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 3, 1875, the United States Congress passed enabling legislation setting out the conditions for Colorado territory to become a state.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 1, 1876 (four weeks after the United States Centennial), US President Ulysse S. Grant signed a proclamation in which he admitted Colorado to the Union as 38th state and earned it the name of "the State of the Centennial".

name: colorado
sentence: The discovery of a large lode of silver near Leadville in 1878 triggered the Colorado Silver Boom.

name: colorado
sentence: The Sherman Silver Purchase Act of 1890 reinvigorated silver mining, and Colorado's last gold strike, but the largest one, at Cripple Creek a few months later, attracted a new generation of gold seekers.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado women were granted the right to vote on 7 November 1893, making Colorado the second state to grant universal suffrage and the first by popular vote (men from Colorado).

name: colorado
sentence: The repeal of the Sherman Silver Purchase Act in 1893 resulted in a horrific collapse of Colorado's mining and agricultural economy, but the state recovered slowly and steadily.

name: colorado
sentence: Between the 1880s and 1930s, the Denver floriculture industry became an important industry in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This period was known locally as the gold rush of the eye.

name: colorado
sentence: The poor working conditions and discontent of the miners led to several major clashes between the strikers and the Colorado National Guard, including the Western Federation of Minors (1903-1904) and the Colorado Coal War, including the Ludlow massacre, which killed a dozen women and children.

name: colorado
sentence: The coal war in 1913-1914 and the streetcar strike in Denver in 1920 led to the intervention of federal troops to put an end to the violence.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1927, the Columbine mine massacre resulted in the deaths of six strikers following a confrontation with the Colorado Rangers.

name: colorado
sentence: It is estimated that more than 5,000 miners from Colorado, many immigrants, have died in accidents since records began to be formally collected following an accident in Crested Butte, which killed 59 in 1884.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado became the first Western state to host a large political assembly when the Democratic Party met in Denver in 1908.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 1930 U.S. census, Colorado's population initially exceeded one million residents.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado suffered greatly from the Great Depression and Dust Bowl of the 1930s, but a great wave of immigration after the Second World War boosted Colorado's fortune.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism has become a pillar of the state economy, and high technology has become an important economic engine.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimated that Colorado's population exceeded five million in 2009.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. naval warships were called the USColorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The first USColorado was appointed to Colorado and served in the civil war and later in the Asian squadron, where he was attacked during the Korean expedition of 1871.

name: colorado
sentence: The last two ships were named in honor of the state, including the USColorado combat ship that served during the Second World War in the Pacific from 1941.

name: colorado
sentence: At the time of Pearl Harbor's attack, this USColorado was located at San Diego Naval Base, Calif.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 11, 1957, a plutonium fire occurred at the Rocky Flats plant, resulting in a significant contamination of plutonium in the surrounding populated areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Since its disappearance by trapping and poisoning the Colorado grey wolf (Canis lupus) in the 1930s, a group of wolves have recolonized Moffat County, Colorado in northwestern Colorado in 2019.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Colorado's population was 5,758,736 in 2019, an increase of 14.51 per cent over the 2010 Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The most populous city and capital in Colorado is Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Greater Denver metropolitan area, with an estimated population of 3,515,374 in 2017, is considered the largest metropolitan area in the state and is located in the Front Range urban corridor, which has approximately five million inhabitants.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest increases are expected in the Front Range urban corridor, especially in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: The fastest growing counties of the state are Douglas and Weld.

name: colorado
sentence: The centre of Colorado's population is located just north of the village of Crichell, Jefferson County.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2010 U.S. Census, Colorado had 5,029,196 inhabitants.

name: colorado
sentence: The racial composition of the State population is as follows:

name: colorado
sentence: Hispanic and Latin American peoples (of all races) account for 20.7 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 Census, the largest ancestry groups in Colorado are German (22%), including Swiss and Austrian, Mexican (18%), Irish (12%) and English (12%).

name: colorado
sentence: People who report German ancestry are particularly numerous in the Front Range, in the Rocky Mountains (Central West Counts) and in the eastern/high plains areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a large proportion of Hispanic citizens, mainly Mexicans and Americans, in Metropolitan Denver, Colorado Springs, as well as in the small towns of Greeley and Pueblo, and elsewhere.

name: colorado
sentence: The south, south-west and south-east of Colorado are home to a large number of Hispanos, descendants of the first Spanish colonial settlers.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1940, the Census Bureau reported that the population of Colorado was 8.2% Hispanics and 90.3% Non-Hispanic Whites.

name: colorado
sentence: The Hispanic population of Colorado has continued to grow rapidly in recent decades.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2019, Hispanics accounted for 22 per cent of Colorado's population, while non-Hispanic whites accounted for 70 per cent.

name: colorado
sentence: The English spoken in Colorado has many Spanish idioms.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado also has large African-American communities located in Denver, Montbello, Five Points, Whittier and many other parts of East Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The state has a large number of Asian-Americans of Mongolian, Chinese, Filipino, Korean, South Asian and Japanese origin.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest population of Asian Americans is on the south and south-east sides of Denver, as well as some on the south-west side of Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver metropolitan area is considered to be more liberal and diverse than most states in terms of political issues and environmental concerns.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado recorded a total of 70,331 births in 2006.

sentence: (Average rate of 14.6 per mile)

sentence: In 2007, non-Hispanic whites were involved in 59.1 per cent of all births.

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 14.06 per cent of these births involved a non-Hispanic white person and a person of a different race, most often with a couple including a Hispanic.

name: colorado
sentence: One birth in which at least one Hispanic person was involved accounted for 43% of births in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: At the 2010 census, Colorado had the seventh percentage of Hispanics (20.7 per cent) in the United States behind New Mexico (46.3 per cent), California (37.6 per cent), Texas (37.6 per cent), Arizona (29.6 per cent), Nevada (26.5 per cent) and Florida (22.5 per cent).

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, the Hispanic population is estimated at 918,899, or about 20 per cent of the total population of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has the fifth largest population of Mexican Americans, behind California, Texas, Arizona, and Illinois.

name: colorado
sentence: In percentage, Colorado ranks 6th among Mexican Americans, behind New Mexico, California, Texas, Arizona and Nevada.

sentence: In 2011, 46% of Colorado's population were younger than the age of a minority, meaning that they had at least one non-Hispanic white parent.
