sentence: Note: Births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race, resulting in a higher overall number.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2017, Colorado had the second lowest fertility rate in the United States outside New England, after Oregon, at 1.63 children per woman.

name: colorado
sentence: The Title X Family Planning Program and Warren Buffett's intrauterine device grant contributed significantly to the decline of pregnancy.

name: colorado
sentence: Spanish is the second most spoken language in Colorado, after English.

name: colorado
sentence: There is a native coloradan language still spoken in Colorado, Colorado River Numic, Ute.

name: colorado
sentence: The main religious affiliations of the Colorado population are 64% Christians, 44% of whom are Protestants, 16% Roman Catholics, 3% Mormons and 1% Eastern Orthodox.

name: colorado
sentence: Other religious divisions are: 1% Jewish, 1% Muslim, 1% Buddhist and 4% other.

name: colorado
sentence: Unaffiliated religious members account for 29 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest denominations by the number of adherents in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 811,630; non-denominational evangelical Protestants with 229,981; and the Church of Jesus Christ of last-day saints with 151,433.

name: colorado
sentence: According to several studies, Coloradans have the lowest obesity rates in any state in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, 24 per cent of the population was considered obese from a medical point of view and, if it were the lowest in the country, the percentage had dropped from 17 per cent in 2004.

name: colorado
sentence: According to a report published in the Journal of the American Medical Association, people in Colorado had a life expectancy of 80.21 years in 2014, the longest in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of film productions have been filmed on site in Colorado, particularly in major westerns such as True Grit, The Searchers, Butch Cassidy and Sundance Kid.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of historic military forts, railways with trains still in operation, phantom mining cities have been used and transformed for historical accuracy in well-known films.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of panoramic highways and mountain passes that have helped highlight the open road in films such as Vanishing Point, Bingo and Starman.

name: colorado
sentence: Some Colorado monuments have been featured in films such as The Stanley Hotel in Dumb and Dumber and The Shining and the Sculptured House in Sleeper.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2015, Furious 7 was scheduled to film driving sequences on Pikes Peak Highway, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The TV series Good Luck Charlie was filmed in Denver, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Office of Film and Television found that more than 400 films were filmed in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of movie festivals in Colorado, including Aspen Shortsfest, Boulder International Film Festival, Castle Rock Film Festival, Denver Film Festival, Festivus Film Festival (finished 2013), Mile High Horror Film Festival, Moondance International Film Festival, Mountainfilm in Telluride, Rocky Mountain Women's Film Festival and Telluride Film Festival.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its southwest and Rocky Mountain cuisine.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexican restaurants are prominent all over the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado, was named the most gastronomic city in America 2010 by Bon Appetit.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, and Colorado in general, are home to a number of national food and beverage companies, leading restaurants, and agricultural markets.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado also has more master sommeliers per capita than any other city, including San Francisco and New York City.

name: colorado
sentence: The Food & Wine Classic is held every June in Aspen, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Aspen also has a reputation as the culinary capital of the Rocky Mountains region.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is known for his steak, but now has a diverse culinary scene with many restaurants.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado wines include award-winning varieties that have attracted positive attention from outside the state.

name: colorado
sentence: With traditional Vitis vinifera grape-based wines and cherries, peaches, plums and honey, Colorado wines have won national and international prizes for their quality.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's wine regions contain the highest vineyards in the United States, with most of the state's viticulture being between 4,000 and 7,000 feet (1,219 and 2,134 m) above sea level.

name: colorado
sentence: The mountain climate ensures warm summer days and cool nights.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to two U.S. wine-growing areas in the Grand Valley AVA and West Elks AVA, where most of the state's vineyards are located.

name: colorado
sentence: However, a growing number of wineries are located along the Front chain.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, Wine Enthusiast Magazine named Colorado's Grand Valley AVA in Mesa County, Colorado, as one of ten wine travel destinations in the world.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to many nationally recognized microbreweries, including the New Belgium Brewing Company, Odell Brewing Company, Great Divide Brewing Company, and Bristol Brewing Company.

name: colorado
sentence: The northern Colorado region, near and between the towns of Denver, Boulder and Fort Collins, is known as the "Napa Valley of Beer" because of its high density of artisanal breweries.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is open for cannabis tourism (marijuana).

name: colorado
sentence: With the adoption of their 64th State Amendment in 2013, Colorado became the first state in the Union to legalize the medicinal, industrial and recreational use of marijuana (2000).

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado marijuana industry sold $1.31 billion in marijuana in 2016 and $1.26 billion in the first three quarters of 2017.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2016, the government generated $194 million in tax revenues, fees and licences on legal marijuana sales.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado regulates hemp like any part of the plant with less than 0.3% THC.

name: colorado
sentence: Amendment 64, adopted by voters in the 2012 general election, obliges the Colorado State Parliament to enact laws governing the cultivation, processing and sale of recreational marijuana and industrial hemp.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 4, 2014, Senator Bill 14-184 on the oversight of Colorado's industrial hemp program was introduced for the first time and was finally passed by Governor John Hickenlooper on May 31, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: On 7 November 2000, 54% of Colorado voters adopted Amendment 20, which amends the Constitution of the State of Colorado to allow the medical use of marijuana.

name: colorado
sentence: Medical use of marijuana by the patient, within the following limits, is legal:

name: colorado
sentence: Currently, Colorado has listed "eight medical conditions for which patients can use marijuana – cancer, glaucoma, HIV/AIDS, muscle spasms, seizures, severe pain, nausea and severe cachexia, or dramatic weight loss and muscle atrophy".

name: colorado
sentence: While governor, John Hickenlooper has allocated about half of the 13 million dollars of the state "Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund" to medical research in Budget 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, the Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund was the "greatest stock of pot money in the state" and was used to fund programs including research on paediatric applications to control the symptoms of autism.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 6, 2012, voters amended the state constitution to protect "personal use" of marijuana for adults, establishing a framework to regulate marijuana in a manner similar to that of alcohol.

name: colorado
sentence: The first recreational marijuana stores in Colorado and by extension in the U.S. opened on January 1, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has five large professional sports leagues, all based in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is the least populous with a franchise in each of the major professional sports leagues.

name: colorado
sentence: The Pikes Peak International Hill Climb is a major climbing motor race on the Pikes Peak Highway.

name: colorado
sentence: The Cherry Hills Country Club hosted several professional golf tournaments, including the US Open, US Senator Open, US Women's Open, PGA Championship and BMW Championship.

name: colorado
sentence: The following universities and colleges participate in Division I of the National Sports College Association.

name: colorado
sentence: The most popular university sports program is the University of Colorado Buffaloes, which played in the Big-12 but now plays in the Pac-12.

name: colorado
sentence: They won the 1957 Orange Bowl and 1991, the 1995 Fiesta Bowl and the 1996 Cotton Bowl Classic.

name: colorado
sentence: The list of the CNBC Top States for Business for 2010 recognized Colorado as the third best state in the nation, reaching only Texas and Virginia.

name: colorado
sentence: The Government's total revenue in 2015 was $318.6 billion.

name: colorado
sentence: The median annual household income in 2016 was $70,666, 8th in the country.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2010, per capita personal income was $51,940, placing Colorado 11th in the nation.

name: colorado
sentence: The state economy expanded from its roots in the mid-19th century in mining when irrigated agriculture developed, and by the end of the 19th century cattle rearing had become important.

name: colorado
sentence: The first industries were based on extraction and processing of minerals and agricultural products.

name: colorado
sentence: Currently, agricultural products include livestock, wheat, dairy products, maize and hay.

name: colorado
sentence: The federal government is also a major economic force in the state with many major federal facilities, including NORAD (North American Aerospace Defense Command), the United States Air Force Academy, the Schriever Air Force Base approximately 16 kilometres east of the Peterson Air Force Base and Fort Carson, both located in Colorado Springs, El Paso County; NOAA, the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) in Golden, and the National Institute of Standards and Technology in Boulder; the US Geological Survey and other government agencies at the Denver Federal Center near Lakewood; Denver Mint, Buckley Air Force Base, the tenth circuit appeal court, and Byron G. Rogers Federal Building and the United States Courthouse in Denver; and a federal Supermax prison and other federal prisons near Cañon City.

name: colorado
sentence: In addition to these federal agencies and others, Colorado has abundant national forest lands and four national parks that contribute to the federal ownership of 24,615,788 acres (99,617 km2) of land in Colorado, or 37% of the total area of the state.In the second half of the 20th century, the industrial and service sectors expanded considerably.

name: colorado
sentence: The state economy is diverse and remarkable in its concentration in the fields of scientific research and high technology.

name: colorado
sentence: Other industries include food processing, transportation equipment, machinery, chemicals, metal mining such as gold (see gold mining in Colorado), silver, and molybdenum.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado currently has the largest annual beer production in any state.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is an important funding center.

name: colorado
sentence: The geographical diversity of the state and the majestic mountains attract millions of tourists each year, 85.2 million of them in 2018.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism is a major contributor to the Colorado economy, with tourists generating $22.3 billion in 2018.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of nationally known brands originate from Colorado factories and laboratories.

name: colorado
sentence: De Denver was the forerunner of the telecommunications giant Qwest in 1879, Samsonite luggage in 1910, Gates belts and pipes in 1911, and Russell Stover Candies in 1923.

name: colorado
sentence: Kuner canned vegetables started in Brighton in 1864.

name: colorado
sentence: De Golden came to Coors beer in 1873, CoorsTek industrial ceramic in 1920, and Jolly Rancher candy in 1949.

name: colorado
sentence: CF&I rails, wires, nails and pipes began in Pueblo in 1892.

name: colorado
sentence: Holly Sugar was first milled from beet in Holly in 1905, then moved its head office to Colorado Springs.

name: colorado
sentence: Today Greeley's Swift packaged meat evolved from Monfort of Colorado, Inc., established in 1930.

name: colorado
sentence: Estes rockets were launched at Penrose in 1958.

name: colorado
sentence: Fort Collins has been the headquarters of the Woodward Governor Company (Governors) controllers since 1870 and Waterpik dental jets and shower heads since 1962.

name: colorado
sentence: Celestial Seasonings herbal teas have been manufactured in Boulder since 1969.

name: colorado
sentence: Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory made its first candies in Durango in 1981.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has an income tax of 4.63%, regardless of the level of income.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 3, 2020, electors approved an initiative to reduce this tax rate to 4.55%.

name: colorado
sentence: Unlike most states, which calculate taxes based on federal adjusted gross income, Colorado taxes are based on taxable income — income after federal exemption and detailed (or standard) federal deductions.

name: colorado
sentence: The State of Colorado sales tax is 2.9% on retail sales.

name: colorado
sentence: When government revenues exceed the constitutional limits of the state, according to the Colorado Taxpayer's Bill of Rights, Colorado residents of the entire year may claim a refund of sales tax on their individual state income tax returns.

name: colorado
sentence: Many counties and cities charge their own rates, in addition to the state base rate.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also county and district special taxes that can apply.

name: colorado
sentence: Real and personal property is taxable in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The State property tax exemption was temporarily suspended by the Colorado Legislative Assembly in 2003.

name: colorado
sentence: Tax relief was to be reported for the 2006 contribution year, payable in 2007.

name: colorado
sentence: In December 2018, the state's unemployment rate was 4.2%.

name: colorado
sentence: The 2018 West Virginia Teachers' Strike inspired teachers in other states, including Colorado, to take similar steps.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has important hydrocarbon resources.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the Energy Information Administration, Colorado is home to seven of the nation's one hundred largest natural gas fields, and two of its one hundred largest oil fields.

name: colorado
sentence: Conventional and unconventional production of natural gas from several Colorado basins typically accounts for more than 5% of the annual production of natural gas in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado oil shale deposits contain about 1 trillion barrels (160 km3) of oil, almost as much oil as the world's proven oil reserves; however, the economic viability of the oil shale has not been demonstrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Significant deposits of bituminous, subbituminous and lignite coal are present in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Uranium mining in Colorado dates back to 1872, when pitchblende ore was mined from gold mines near Central City, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado uranium industry has experienced booms and failures, but it continues to this day.

name: colorado
sentence: In addition to phosphate-derived uranium, Colorado is considered to have the third largest pool of uranium in any U.S. state, behind Wyoming and New Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: Uranium price increases between 2001 and 2007 prompted a number of companies to restart uranium mining in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The lower prices and financing problems at the end of 2008 forced these companies to cancel or reduce the uranium mining project.

name: colorado
sentence: There are currently no uranium mines in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The high peaks of the Colorado Rockies and the eastern plains offer wind energy potential, and geological activity in mountainous areas offers potential for geothermal energy development.

name: colorado
sentence: A large part of the state is sunny and could produce solar energy.

name: colorado
sentence: The major rivers flowing from the Rocky Mountains offer hydroelectric resources.

name: colorado
sentence: Corn grown in the eastern flat state provides potential resources for ethanol production.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's main (passenger) mode of transportation is its road network.

name: colorado
sentence: Interstate 25 (I-25) is the main north-south highway between Pueblo, Colorado Springs, Denver and Fort Collins, extending north to Wyoming and south to New Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The I-70 is the main east-west corridor.

name: colorado
sentence: It connects Grand Junction and mountain communities to Denver and enters Utah and Kansas.

name: colorado
sentence: The state is home to a network of U.S. and Colorado highways that provide access to all major parts of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Many small communities are connected to the network only by county roads.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver International Airport (DIA) is the fifth busiest airport in the United States and the 20th busiest airport in the world by passenger traffic.

name: colorado
sentence: DIA manages by far the largest volume of commercial air traffic in Colorado, and is the busiest American hub airport between Chicago and the Pacific coast, making Denver the most important airport to connect passenger traffic in the western United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Extensive public transport bus services are available both within and between cities, including extensive RTD services in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: The Regional Transport District (RTD) operates the popular bus and rail transportation system in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: In January 2013, there were 170 light rail vehicles serving 47 miles (76 km) of rail.

name: colorado
sentence: Amtrak operates two passenger railway lines in Colorado, the California Zephyr and the Southwest Chief.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's contribution to the history of the world railway was forged primarily by the Denver and Rio Grande Western railways, which began in 1870 and wrote the book on the mountain railway.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1988 the "Rio Grande" acquired but was merged in, the Southern Pacific Railroad by their co-owner Philip Anschutz.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 11, 1996, Anschutz sold the combined company to the Union Pacific Railroad, creating the largest railway network in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: The sale of Anschutz was in part a result of the earlier merger of Burlington Northern and Santa Fe, which formed the great Burlington Northern and Santa Fe Railway (BNSF), the main competitor of the Union Pacific in the western U.S. railway sector.

name: colorado
sentence: The Union Pacific and BNSF both have significant freight transportation activities in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado freight rail network consists of 2,688 miles of Class I track.

name: colorado
sentence: It is an integral part of the U.S. economy, being a critical artery for the movement of energy, agriculture, mining and industrial products, as well as general goods and manufactured goods between the East and Midwest and Pacific coastal states.

name: colorado
sentence: In August 2014, Colorado began issuing driver's licences to foreigners who were not legally resident in the United States and who lived in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: In September 2014, KCNC reported that 524 non-citizens were issued driving licences in Colorado, which are normally issued to U.S. citizens living in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Like the federal government and all other U.S. states, the constitution of the State of Colorado provides for three branches of government: the legislature, the executive and the judiciary.

name: colorado
sentence: The Governor of Colorado directs the executive power of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: The present governor is Jared Polis, Democrat.

name: colorado
sentence: Other Colorado-wide elected leaders are the Lieutenant Governor of Colorado (elected on a note with the Governor), the Colorado Secretary of State, the Colorado Treasurer of State and the Colorado Attorney General, all holding a four-year term.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Supreme Court is the highest court in the state with seven judges.

name: colorado
sentence: The Court of Appeal of Colorado, composed of 22 judges, sits in divisions of three judges each.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is divided into 22 judicial districts, each having a district court and a county court with limited jurisdiction.

name: colorado
sentence: The State also has a water court, which sits in seven separate divisions around the State and decides on matters relating to water rights, use and administration.

name: colorado
sentence: The legislative body of the State is the Colorado General Assembly, which consists of two chambers - the House of Representatives and the Senate.

name: colorado
sentence: The House has 65 members, and the senator has 35.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, the Democratic Party held a majority of 19-16 in the Senate and a majority of 41-24 in Parliament.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of the Coloradians come from other states (almost 60% according to the 2000 census), which is illustrated by the fact that the state did not have a 1975 native governor (when John David Vanderhoof left his post) until 2007, when Bill Ritter took office; his election the previous year marked the first election victory of a native Coloradan in a gubernatory race since 1958 (Vanderhoof had taken up the post of lieutenant governor when John Arthur Love obtained a position in Richard Nixon's administration in 1973).

name: colorado
sentence: In the 2016 elections, the Democratic Party won the votes of the Colorado Electoral University.

name: colorado
sentence: Tax is collected by the Colorado Revenue Department.

name: colorado
sentence: The State of Colorado is divided into 64 counties.

name: colorado
sentence: Counties are important government units in Colorado since the state does not have secondary civil subdivisions such as the townships.

name: colorado
sentence: Two of these counties, Denver City and County and Broomfield City and County, have consolidated city and county governments.

name: colorado
sentence: Nine Colorado counties have a population of over 250,000 each, while eight Colorado counties have a population of less than 2,500 each.

name: colorado
sentence: The ten most populated Colorado counties are all located in the Front Range urban corridor.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States Office of Management and Budget (OMB) has defined a Combined Statistical Area (CSA), seven Metropolitan Statistical Zones (MSA) and seven Micropolitan Statistical Zones (μSA) in Colorado State.

name: colorado
sentence: The statistical area of Denver-Aurora-Broomfield, CO Metropolitan Statistical Area, is the most populous of the 14 basic statistical regions of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This region had an estimated population of 2,888,227 on July 1, 2017, an increase of +13.55 per cent since the 2010 United States Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest Denver-Aurora-Boulder, a combined statistical area of CO, had an estimated population of 3,515,374 on July 1, 2017, an increase of +13.73% since the 2010 United States Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The most populous metropolitan area in the Rocky Mountains region is the Front Range urban corridor along the northeast side of the Southern Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: This region with Denver at its centre had an estimated population of 4,495,181 as of 1 July 2012, an increase of +3.73% since the 2010 United States Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The State of Colorado currently has 271 incorporated municipalities, including 196 cities, 73 cities, and two municipalities and counties.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado municipalities fall under one of five types of municipal authorities.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a city with a territorial charter, 160 statutory cities, 12 statutory cities, 96 home municipalities (61 cities and 35 cities) and two consolidated city and county governments.

name: colorado
sentence: In addition to its 271 municipalities, Colorado has 187 designated places for the census and many other small communities.

name: colorado
sentence: The State of Colorado has over 3,000 districts with tax authority.

name: colorado
sentence: These districts may provide schools, law enforcement services, fire protection, water, wastewater, drainage, irrigation, transportation, recreation, infrastructure, cultural facilities, business support, rehabilitation or other services.

name: colorado
sentence: Some of these districts have the authority to collect sales tax, as well as property tax and user fees.

name: colorado
sentence: This has led to a hodgepodge of sales taxes and property tax rates in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are a few street intersections in Colorado with a different sales tax rate at each corner, sometimes substantially different.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is considered a swing state or (most recently) a blue state in both state and federal elections.

name: colorado
sentence: In the presidential elections, it had only been won in 2020 by two digits since 1984 and supported the winning candidate in 9 of the last 11 elections.

name: colorado
sentence: The Coloradans have elected 17 Democrats and 12 Republicans as governors over the past 100 years.

name: colorado
sentence: In presidential politics, Colorado was considered a reliable republican state in the post-world war period, voting for the Democratic candidate only in 1948, 1964 and 1992.

name: colorado
sentence: However, it became a competitive swing in the 1990s.

name: colorado
sentence: Since the mid-2000s he has climbed heavily to the Democrats, voting for Barack Obama in 2008 and 2012, Hillary Clinton in 2016 and Joe Biden in 2020.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado politics contrasted conservative cities such as Colorado Springs and Grand Junction with liberal cities such as Boulder and Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: Democrats are the strongest in the metropolis of Denver, the collegial cities of Fort Collins and Boulder, southern Colorado (including Pueblo), and a number of western ski resort counties.

name: colorado
sentence: Republicans are the strongest in the eastern plains, Colorado Springs, Greeley and far west of Colorado near Grand Junction.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is represented by seven representatives in the House of Representatives of the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1881, Colorado voters approved a referendum that chose Denver as the capital of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado was the first state of the union to pass, by electoral referendum, a law extending the suffrage to women.

name: colorado
sentence: This initiative was approved by state voters on 7 November 1893.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 8, 1932, Colorado approved the repeal of the alcohol ban more than one year before the ratification of the twenty-first amendment to the United States Constitution.

sentence: Colorado banned by C.R.S.

name: colorado
sentence: Section 12-6-302, sale of motor vehicles on Sundays since 1953 at least.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1972, Colorado voters rejected a referendum proposal to fund the 1976 Olympic Winter Games, to be held in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver was selected by the International Olympic Committee as the host city on 12 May 1970.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2006, voters adopted Amendment 43, which was intended to prohibit same-sex marriages in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This initiative was set aside by the decision of the Supreme Court of the United States in 2015 in Obergefell v. Hodges.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2012, voters amended the state constitution protecting the "personal use" of marijuana for adults, establishing a framework for regulating cannabis in a manner similar to that of alcohol.

name: colorado
sentence: The first recreational marijuana stores in Colorado and by extension in the U.S. opened on January 1, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: On May 29, 2019, Governor Jared Polis signed House Bill 1124 immediately prohibiting Colorado law enforcement officials from detaining undocumented immigrants solely on the basis of a U.S. immigration and enforcement request.

name: colorado
sentence: The former military installations and outposts are as follows:

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to 4 national parks, 8 national monuments, 2 national recreational areas, 2 national historic sites, 3 national historic trails, 1 national panoramic trail, 11 national forests, 2 national grasslands, 42 national nature reserves, 2 national conservation areas, 8 national wildlife shelters, 44 state parks, 307 state wildlife reserves and many other tourist, historical and recreational areas.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is a state in the northeastern U.S. state of New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the 2010 census, it has the highest per capita income, the Human Development Index (0.962) and the median household income in the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is bordered by Rhode Island in the east, Massachusetts in the north, New York in the west, and Long Island Sound in the south.

name: connecticut
sentence: Its capital is Hartford, and its most populous city is Bridgeport.

name: connecticut
sentence: Geographically, the state is part of New England, and although its cultural history comes from the region, in the modern era, large sections of it are increasingly linked to the three-state region with New York and New Jersey.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state is named for the Connecticut River which approximately bisects the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The word "Connecticut" is derived from various anglicized spellings of "Quononoquett (Conanicut)," a word Mohegan-Pequot for "long tidal river".

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European settlers in Connecticut were Dutch who established a small, short-lived settlement called Fort Hoop in Hartford at the confluence of the park and Connecticut Rivers.

name: connecticut
sentence: Half of Connecticut was originally part of the Dutch colony New Netherlands, which included much of the land between Connecticut and Delaware, although the first major colonies were established by the English in the 1630s.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thomas Hooker led a band of followers from the Massachusetts Bay colony and founded the Connecticut colony

name: connecticut
sentence: The colonies of Connecticut and New Haven have prepared basic documents, considered the first constitutions in America.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662 the three colonies were merged under a royal charter, making Connecticut a colony of the crown.

name: connecticut
sentence: It was one of the Thirteen Colonies that rejected British rule in the American Revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is the third smallest state per zone, the 29th most populated, and the fourth most densely populated of the 50 states.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is known as the "State of the Constitution", the "State of Nutmeg", the "State of Provision" and the "State of the Steady Habits".

name: connecticut
sentence: It influenced the development of the U.S. federal government (see Connecticut Compromise).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River, the Thames River and ports along Long Island Strait have given Connecticut a strong maritime tradition that continues today.

name: connecticut
sentence: The government also has a long history of hosting the financial services sector, including insurance companies in Hartford and hedge funds in Fairfield County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is bordered south by Long Island Sound, west by New York, north by Massachusetts and east by Rhode Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state capital and the fourth largest city is Hartford, and other large cities (by population) include Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, New Britain, Greenwich and Bristol.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is slightly larger than Montenegro.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are 169 incorporated cities in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest peak of Connecticut is Bear Mountain in Salisbury in the northwest corner of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest point is just east of Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New York (42°3′ N, 73°29′ W), on the southern slope of Mount Frissell, which peaks near Massachusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the extreme opposite, many coastal cities have areas less than 20 feet (6 m) above sea level.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a long maritime history and a reputation based on this history, but the state has no direct (technically speaking) seafront.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut coast is located on Long Island Strait, an estuary.

name: connecticut
sentence: State access to the open Atlantic Ocean is to both the west (to the city of New York) and the east (to the "race" near Rhode Island).

name: connecticut
sentence: This situation provides many safe harbours from ocean storms, and many transatlantic ships seek anchor within Long Island Strait when tropical cyclones pass off the upper east coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River crosses the central part of the state, pouring into Long Island Strait.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most populated metropolitan area in the centre of the state is in the Connecticut River Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Despite the relatively small size of Connecticut, it has large regional variations in its landscape; for example, in the northwest of Litchfield Hills it includes mountains and horse farms, while in areas east of New Haven along the coast, the landscape includes coastal marshes, beaches and large-scale marine activities.

name: connecticut
sentence: The rural areas and small towns of Connecticut in the northeast and northwest corners of the state contrast strongly with its industrial cities such as Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven, located along the coastal highways of the New York border to New London, then north to the Connecticut River to Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many cities in the northeast and northwest of Connecticut center around a green.

name: connecticut
sentence: Near the green usually stand historical visual symbols of New England's cities, such as a white church, colonial meeting house, colonial tavern or inn, several colonial houses, etc., establishing a picturesque historical appearance maintained for historical preservation and tourism.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many of the southern and coastal regions of Connecticut have been built and rebuilt over the years, and look less visually like traditional New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The northern boundary of the state with Massachusetts is marked by the Southwick Jog or Granby Notch, a square detour of approximately 4.0 kilometres in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The origin of this anomaly is clearly established in a long series of temporary disputes and agreements that were finally concluded in 1804, when residents of southern Southwick sought to leave Massachusetts, and the city was divided into two.

name: connecticut
sentence: The southwestern border of Connecticut, where it stops in New York State, is marked by a panhandle in Fairfield County, containing the cities of Greenwich, Stamford, New Canaan, Darien, and parts of Norwalk and Wilton.

name: connecticut
sentence: This irregularity in the border is the result of territorial disputes at the end of the 17th century, culminating with New York abandoning its claim to the area, whose inhabitants considered themselves to be part of Connecticut, in exchange for an equivalent area extending north of Ridgefield on the Massachusetts border, as well as the undisputed claim of Rye, New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: Areas maintained by the National Parks Service include the Appalachian National Scenic Trail, the National Heritage Corridor of the Quinebaug and Shetucket Rivers Valley and Weir Farm National Historic Site.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is located in the difficult transition zone between the southern extremity of the humid continental climate and the northern part of the humid subtropical climate.

name: connecticut
sentence: Northern Connecticut generally has a climate with cold winters with moderate snowfalls and warm and humid summers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The extreme south and the coast of Connecticut have a climate with cool winters with a mixture of rain and rare snow, and the long warm and humid summers typical of the middle and lower East coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut sees a fairly uniform precipitation pattern with precipitation and snowfall spread over the 12-month period.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut accounts for an average of 56% of the possible sunlight (higher than the U.S. national average), an average of 2400 hours of sunshine per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: Early spring (April) can be slightly cool (40s to 50s F) warm (65 to 70 F), while mid and late spring (late April/May) are warm.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the end of May, the Bermuda High Building created a southern flow of warm, humid tropical air, bringing warm weather conditions throughout the state, with high capacity in New London of 81°F (27°C) and 85°F (29°C) in Windsor Locks at the top of the summer in late July.

name: connecticut
sentence: Occasionally, heat waves of 90 to 100 °F (38 °C) occur throughout Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Although summers are sunny in Connecticut, fast-moving summer thunderstorms can cause brief flooding with thunder and lightning.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sometimes, these thunderstorms can be severe, and the condition on average one tornado per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the hurricane season, remnants of tropical cyclones occasionally affect the region, although a direct impact is rare.

name: connecticut
sentence: The time generally associated with the fall season generally begins in October and lasts until the first days of December.

name: connecticut
sentence: The daily temperatures in October and November range from the 50s to the 60s (Fahrenheit) with nights in the 40s and 30s.

name: connecticut
sentence: Colourful foliage begins in early October in the northern parts of the state and moves south and east to the southeast of Connecticut in early November.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, southern and coastal regions have more oaks and hickory (and fewer maples) and are often less colourful than northern regions.

name: connecticut
sentence: In December, the highs of day are in 40°F for much of the state, and the lows of night are below freezing.

name: connecticut
sentence: Winters (from December to mid-March) are generally cold from south to north in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The coldest month (January) has high mean temperatures ranging from 38°F (3°C) in the coastal lowlands to 33°F (1°C) in the interior and northern parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Average annual snowfall ranges from 60 inches (1,500 mm) at high elevations in the northern part of the state to only 20-25 inches (510-640 mm) along the southeast coast of Connecticut (Branford to Groton).

name: connecticut
sentence: In general, any community north or west of Interstate 84 receives the most snow during a storm and throughout the season.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most Connecticut has less than 60 days of snow cover.

name: connecticut
sentence: Snow generally falls from late November to late March in the northern part of the State, and from early December to mid-March in the southern and coastal parts of the State.

name: connecticut
sentence: The record temperature of Connecticut is 106°F (41°C) which occurred in Danbury on 15 July 1995; the low record is −32°F (−36°C) which occurred in the Northwest Hills Falls Village on 16 February 1943, and Coventry on 22 January 1961.

name: connecticut
sentence: The forests consist of a mixture of coastal forests northeast of Oak in the southern regions of the state, up to the high forests of New England and Acadia in the northwestern parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mountain Laurel (Kalmia latifolia) is the state flower and is native to low ridges in several parts of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Rosebay Rhododendron (maximum Rhododendron) is also native to the Eastern Highlands of Connecticut and the Pachaug State Forest houses the Rhododendron Sanctuary Trail.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Atlantic white cedar (Chamaecyparis thyoides) is found in wetlands in the southern part of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a native cactus (Opuntia humifusa), found in sandy coastal areas and low hills.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many types of beach grasses and wildflowers are also native to Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut covers hardiness areas of USDA plants 5b to 7a.

name: connecticut
sentence: Coastal Connecticut is the vast transition area where more southern and subtropical plants are grown.

name: connecticut
sentence: In some coastal communities, Magnolia grandiflora (southern magnolia), Crape Myrtle, palm scrub (Sabal minor), Needle Palms (Rhapidophyllum hystrix) and other sempervirent leaves are grown in small numbers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The name Connecticut is derived from the word Mohegan-Pequot which has been translated as "long tidal river" and "long river", referring to the Connecticut River.

name: connecticut
sentence: Evidence of human presence in the Connecticut region dates back 10,000 years.

name: connecticut
sentence: Stone tools have been used for hunting, fishing and carpentry.

name: connecticut
sentence: Semi-nomads in the way of life, these people move seasonally to take advantage of various resources in the region.

name: connecticut
sentence: They shared Algonquian-based languages.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut region was inhabited by many Amerindian tribes that can be grouped into the Nipmuc, the Sequins or the "River Indians" (which included Tunxis, Schaghticoke, Podunk, Wangunk, Hammonasset and Quinnipiac), Mattabesec or the "Wolf Confederation" and Pequot-Mohegan.

name: connecticut
sentence: Some of these groups remain in Connecticut, including Mohegans, Pequots and Paugusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European explorer in Connecticut was Dutch explorer Adriaen Block, who explored the region in 1614.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Dutch fur traders then sailed on the Connecticut River, which they called Versche Rivier ("Fresh River"), and built a fort at Dutch Point in Hartford, which they named "House of Hope" (Dutch: Huis van Hoop).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut colony was originally a number of small distinct colonies in Windsor, Wethersfield, Saybrook, Hartford and New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first English settlers came in 1633 and settled in Windsor, then in Wethersfield the following year.

name: connecticut
sentence: John Winthrop the youth of Massachusetts received a commission for the establishment of the Saybrook settlement at the mouth of the Connecticut River in 1635.

name: connecticut
sentence: The main body of settlers arrived in a large group in 1636.

name: connecticut
sentence: They were Puritans of the Massachusetts Bay colony led by Thomas Hooker, who established the Connecticut colony at Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Quinnipiack colony was established by John Davenport, Theophilus Eaton and others in New Haven in March 1638.

name: connecticut
sentence: The colony of New Haven had its own constitution called "the fundamental agreement of the colony of New Haven", signed on June 4, 1639.

name: connecticut
sentence: The regulations were made without official sanction from the English Crown, and each of them was an independent political entity.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662 Winthrop went to England and obtained a charter from Charles II which united the colonies of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The colonial colonies of historic significance were Windsor (1633), Wethersfield (1634), Saybrook (1635), Hartford (1636), New Haven (1638), Fairfield (1639), Guilford (1639), Milford (1639), Stratford (1639), Farmington (1640), Stamford (1641) and New London (1646).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequot War marked the first major confrontation between colonists and Amerindians in New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequots have reacted with increasing aggression to colonial settlements on their territory, while simultaneously taking land from the Narragansett and Mohegan tribes.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlers responded to a murder in 1636 with a raid on a village of Pequot on Block Island; the Pequots besieged the Saybrook Colony garrison that fall and then attacked Wethersfield in the spring of 1637.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlers declared war on the Pequots, organized a group of militias and allies of the Mohegan and Narragansett tribes, and attacked a village of Pequot on the Mystic River, with estimates of deaths ranging from 300 to 700 Pequots.

name: connecticut
sentence: After suffering another major loss in a battle at Fairfield, the Pequots demanded a truce and terms of peace.

name: connecticut
sentence: The western limits of Connecticut have been subject to changes over time.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Hartford Treaty with the Dutch was signed on 19 Sept. 1650, but it was never ratified by the British.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to her, the western boundary of Connecticut extended north of Greenwich Bay over a distance of 32 km, provided that the said line is not less than 10 miles from the Hudson River.

name: connecticut
sentence: This agreement was observed by both parties until the war broke out between England and the Netherlands in 1652.

name: connecticut
sentence: The conflict continued with regard to colonial boundaries until the Duke of York seized New Netherlands in 1664.

name: connecticut
sentence: On the other hand, the original Charter of Connecticut in 1662 granted it all the land to the "South Sea", that is to say the Pacific Ocean.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most royal colonial concessions were granted to long east-west bands.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut takes its donation seriously and establishes a ninth county between the Susquehanna River and the Delaware River, Westmoreland County.

name: connecticut
sentence: The result was a short Pennamite war with Pennsylvania.

name: connecticut
sentence: Yale College was founded in 1701, providing Connecticut with an important institution to educate the clergy and civilian leaders.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Congregational Church dominated religious life in the colony and by extension, municipal affairs in many parts.

name: connecticut
sentence: With more than 600 miles of coastline, including along its navigable rivers, during the colonial years Connecticut developed a history of a maritime tradition that would later produce booms in shipbuilding, shipping, naval support, seafood production and recreational boating.

name: connecticut
sentence: Historical records indicate that the Tryall was the first ship built in the Connecticut colony in 1649 on a site on the Connecticut River in the present Wethersfield.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the two decades preceding 1776 and the American Revolution, the shipyards of Connecticut launched about 100 sloops, schooners and brigs according to an American customs database maintained online by the Mystic Seaport Museum, the most important being the 180-ton Patient Mary launched at New Haven in 1763.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first lighthouse in Connecticut was built in 1760 at the mouth of the Thames River with the lighthouse in New London Harbour.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut nominated four delegates to the Second Continental Congress who signed the Declaration of Independence: Samuel Huntington, Roger Sherman, William Williams and Oliver Wolcott.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut legislature authorized six new regiments in 1775, following clashes between British regulars and Massachusetts militiamen in Lexington and Concord.

name: connecticut
sentence: There were about 1,200 troops from Connecticut at the Battle of Bunker Hill in June 1775.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1775, David Bushnell invented the Turtle, which, the following year, launched the first underwater attack in history, in vain against a British warship at anchor in the port of New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1777, the British received news of supplies from the Continental Army in Danbury, and landed an expeditionary force of about 2,000 soldiers in Westport.

name: connecticut
sentence: This force then marched to Danbury and destroyed houses and a large part of the depot.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mainland army troops and militias led by General David Wooster and General Benedict Arnold hired them when they marched back to Ridgefield in 1777.

name: connecticut
sentence: For the winter of 1778–79, General George Washington decided to divide the Continental Army into three divisions around New York City, where British General Sir Henry Clinton had taken his winter quarters.

name: connecticut
sentence: Major General Israel Putnam chose Redding as a winter camp for some 3,000 regulars and militiamen under his command.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Redding camp allowed Putnam soldiers to keep the reconstituted supply depot at Danbury and to support any operation along Long Island Strait and the Hudson River Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Some of these men were veterans of the winter camp at Valley Forge, Pennsylvania, the previous winter.

name: connecticut
sentence: Soldiers at the Redding camp suffered from supply shortages, cold temperatures and heavy snow, and some historians doubled the Conncticut's Valley Forge camp.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state was also the site of a number of raids on Long Island orchestrated by Samuel Holden Parsons and Benjamin Tallmadge, and provided men and equipment for the war effort, particularly to the Washington army outside New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: General William Tryon raided the coast of Connecticut in July 1779, focusing on New Haven, Norwalk and Fairfield.

name: connecticut
sentence: New London and Groton Heights were attacked in September 1781 by Benedict Arnold, who had betrayed the British.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the beginning of the American Revolution, the Continental Congress designated Nathaniel Shaw Jr. of New London as its naval agent in charge of recruiting privateers to seize British ships as opportunities presented, with nearly 50 operations from the Thames River which eventually fired reprisals from the British force led by Arnold.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut ratified the American Constitution on January 9, 1788, becoming the fifth state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state flourished during the period following the American Revolution, as mills and textile factories were built and seaports flourished from trade and fishing.

name: connecticut
sentence: After Congress established in 1790 the predecessor of the US Revenue Cutter Service that would evolve in the U.S. Coast Guard, President Washington assigned Jonathan Maltbie as one of the seven masters to enforce customs regulations, with Maltbie monitoring the south coast of New England with a 48-foot sloop cup called Argus.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1786, Connecticut transferred the territory to the U.S. government, which was part of the Northwest Territory.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state retained land that extended to the northern part of present-day Ohio, the West Connecticut Reserve.

name: connecticut
sentence: The section of the Western Reserve was largely established by people from Connecticut, and they brought the place names of Connecticut to Ohio.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has entered into agreements with Pennsylvania and New York that have extinguished land claims within those states and created the Connecticut Panhandle.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state then ceded the Western Reserve in 1800 to the federal government, which brought it to its current borders (other than minor adjustments with Massachusetts).

name: connecticut
sentence: For the first time in 1800, the shipwrecked in Connecticut launched more than 100 boats in a single year.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the following decade, at the door of the resumption of hostilities with Great Britain that triggered the War of 1812, the shipyards in Connecticut built nearly 1,000 ships, the most productive stretch of any decade in the 19th century.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the war, the British raided Stonington and Essex and blocked ships in the Thames River.

name: connecticut
sentence: Isaac Hull, originally from Derby, became the most famous naval figure in Connecticut to gain fame during the conflict, as captain of the USConstitution.

name: connecticut
sentence: The British blockade during the War of 1812 hurt exports and strengthened the influence of federalists who opposed the war.

name: connecticut
sentence: The cessation of imports from Great Britain stimulated the construction of factories to manufacture textiles and machinery.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut was recognized as a major manufacturing centre, partly because of the inventions of Eli Whitney and other early innovators of the industrial revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: The war led to the development of fast clippers that helped extend the reach of New England merchants to the Pacific and Indian oceans.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first half of the 19th century also experienced a rapid increase in whaling, with New London appearing as one of the three largest home ports in the New England industry after Nantucket and New Bedford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state was known for its political conservatism, characterized by its federalist party and the Yale College of Timothy Dwight.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most intellectual were Dwight and Noah Webster, who compiled his great dictionary into New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: Religious tensions polarize the state, as the Congregational Church struggles to maintain traditional points of view, in alliance with the federalists.

name: connecticut
sentence: The failure of the Hartford Convention in 1814 was detrimental to the federalist cause, as the Republican Democratic Party took control in 1817.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut had been governed by the "fundamental orders" since 1639, but the state adopted a new constitution in 1818.

name: connecticut
sentence: The manufacturers of Connecticut played a major role in the supply of weapons and supplies to Union forces during the civil war.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state provided 55,000 men, trained in 30 full infantry regiments, including two in the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: Colourful troops, with several Connecticut men becoming generals.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Navy attracted 250 officers and 2,100 men, and Gideon Welles, a native of Glastonbury, served as Secretary of the Navy.

sentence: James H. Ward of Hartford was the first in the United States

name: connecticut
sentence: Naval officer killed in the civil war.

name: connecticut
sentence: Among the victims of Connecticut, 2,088 were killed in combat, 2,801 died of disease and 689 died in confederate prison camps.

sentence: A wave of national unity in 1861 brought thousands of tributaries to the colours of each city and city.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, as the war became a crusade to put an end to slavery, many democrats (especially Irish Catholics) withdrew.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Democrats have taken a position in favour of slavery and have included many copperheads ready to leave the secession of the South.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Republicans fought intensely for the governor's election in 1863.

name: connecticut
sentence: The vast Connecticut industry, its dense population, its flat terrain and its wealth favoured the construction of railways from 1839.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1840, 102 miles (264 km) of the line were in operation, reaching 402 miles (647 km) in 1850 and 601 miles (967 km) in 1860.

name: connecticut
sentence: New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad, called the New Haven or The Consolidated, became the dominant Connecticut railway company after 1872.

name: connecticut
sentence: J. P. Morgan began financing New England's major railways in the 1890s, dividing the territory so that they would not compete.

name: connecticut
sentence: The New Haven purchased 50 small businesses, including steam lines, and built a network of light rails (electrified carriages) that provided long distance transportation for the entire south of New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1912, the New Haven operated more than 2,000 miles (3,200 km) of track with 120,000 employees.

name: connecticut
sentence: As the steam ships proliferated after the Civil War, Noank produced the two largest ships built in Connecticut during the 19th century, with the 332-foot wooden steam wheel Rhode Island launched in 1882 and the 345-foot pallet wheel Connecticut seven years later.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut shipyards would launch more than 165 steam ships in the 19th century.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1875, the first telephone exchange in the world was established in New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: When World War I broke out in 1914, Connecticut became one of the main suppliers of weapons to the American army; in 1918, 80% of the state's industries produced goods for the war effort.

name: connecticut
sentence: Remington Arms in Bridgeport produced half of the U.S. Army's small arms cartridges, along with other major suppliers, including Winchester in New Haven and Colt in Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut was also a major supplier to the U.S. Navy, with electrical boat orders for 85 submarines, the construction of Torpedo Lake boats over 20 submarines and Groton Iron Works cargo ships.

name: connecticut
sentence: On June 21, 1916, the Navy made Groton the site of its base and submarine school on the East Coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state enthusiastically supported the war effort of the United States in 1917 and 1918 with large purchases of war bonds, a further expansion of industry and an emphasis on increasing food production on farms.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thousands of state, local and volunteer groups mobilized for the war effort and were coordinated by the State Defence Council of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Manufacturers faced labour shortages; the American Brass and Manufacturing Company in Waterbury operated at half its capacity, so the federal government agreed to force soldiers to work there.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1919, J. Henry Roraback began the Connecticut Light & Power Co., which became the dominant electrical utility of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1925, Frederick Rentschler encouraged the creation of Pratt & Whitney in Hartford to develop engines for aircraft; the company became a major military supplier during the Second World War and one of the three leading manufacturers of jet engines in the world.

name: connecticut
sentence: On September 21, 1938, the most destructive storm in New England's history hit East Connecticut, killing hundreds of people.

name: connecticut
sentence: The eye of the "Long Island Express" passed just west of New Haven and devastated the coast of Connecticut between Old Saybrook and Stonington from the full force of wind and waves, even though they enjoyed partial protection by Long Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The hurricane caused considerable damage to infrastructure, homes and businesses.

name: connecticut
sentence: In New London, a 150-metre (150-metre) sailing boat was taken to a warehouse, causing a major fire.

name: connecticut
sentence: High rainfall caused flooding of the Connecticut River in downtown Hartford and East Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: An estimated 50,000 trees fell on roads.

name: connecticut
sentence: The advent of the lease loan in support of Britain helped to lift the Connecticut of the Great Depression, with the State a major centre for the production of weapons and supplies used during the Second World War.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut manufactured 4.1% of the total U.S. military armaments produced during the war, ranking ninth among the 48 states, with major factories including Colt for firearms, Pratt & Whitney for aircraft engines, Chance Vought for fighter aircraft, Hamilton Standard for propellers, and Electric Boat for submarines and PT boats.

name: connecticut
sentence: In Bridgeport, General Electric produced an important new weapon to fight the tanks: the bazooka.

name: connecticut
sentence: On May 13, 1940, Igor Sikorsky made a free flight of the first practical helicopter.

name: connecticut
sentence: The helicopter was poorly used during the Second World War, but future military production made the Stratford Sikorsky Aircraft plant the largest manufacturing site in Connecticut in the early 21st century.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut lost some factories in wartime after the end of hostilities, but the state participated in a general post-war expansion that included the construction of highways and led to the growth of the middle class in the suburbs.

name: connecticut
sentence: Prescott Bush represented Connecticut in the U.S. Senate from 1952 to 1963.

name: connecticut
sentence: Bush and the grandson George W. Bush both became presidents of the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1965, Connecticut ratified its current constitution, replacing the document which has served since 1818.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1968, commercial operation of the Connecticut Yankee Nuclear Generating Station in East Haddam began; in 1970, the Millstone Nuclear Generating Station began operating in Waterford.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1974, Connecticut elected democratic governor Ella T. Grasso, who became the first woman in a state to be elected governor without being the wife or widow of a former governor.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's dependence on the defence industry posed an economic challenge at the end of the Cold War.

name: connecticut
sentence: The resulting fiscal crisis led to Lowell Weicker's election as governor on a third-party ticket in 1990.

name: connecticut
sentence: Weicker's appeal was a state income tax that proved effective in balancing the budget, but only in the short term.

name: connecticut
sentence: He did not run for a second term, in part because of this politically unpopular movement.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1992, the initial construction was completed at Foxwoods Casino at Pequots Mashantucket Reserve in Eastern Connecticut, which became the largest casino in the Western Hemisphere.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mohegan Sun follows four years later.

sentence: In 2000, the presidential candidate Al Gore chose Senator Joe Lieberman as a race companion, marking the first time that a presidential ticket from the major party included someone from the Jewish faith.

sentence: Gore and Lieberman fell to five votes below George W. Rowland resigned in an investigation into corruption, later pleading federal charges.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hurricane Irene hit Connecticut on August 28, and damage totalled $235 million.

name: connecticut
sentence: Two months later, the Halloween and the Easter dropped snow on the trees, causing broken branches and trunks that damaged the power lines; some areas were powerless for 11 days.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hurricane Sandy experienced tropical storm winds when it reached Connecticut on October 29, 2012.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sandy's winds have caused storm surges in the streets and reduced electricity to 98% of homes and businesses, with more than $360 million in damage.

name: connecticut
sentence: On December 14, 2012, Adam Lanza shot and killed 26 people at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown.

name: connecticut
sentence: The massacre has stimulated the militants' renewed efforts for stricter laws on the possession of firearms at the national level.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the summer and autumn of 2016, Connecticut experienced drought in many parts of the state, causing some prohibitions on water use.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of November 15, 2016 (2016-11-15), 45% of the state was in severe drought status by the US Secherry Monitor, including almost all Hartford and Litchfield counties.

name: connecticut
sentence: The rest of the state was located in Middlesex, Fairfield, New London, New Haven, Windham and Tolland counties.

name: connecticut
sentence: This situation has affected the state's agricultural economy.

name: connecticut
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the Connecticut population was 3,565,287 as at 1 July 2019, a 0.25 per cent decrease since the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, Connecticut had an estimated population of 3,565,287 people, a decrease of 7,378 (0.25%) from the previous year and a decrease of 8,810 (0.25%) since 2010.

name: connecticut
sentence: This includes a natural increase since the last census of 67,427 (22,222 births minus 154,795 deaths) and an increase due to net migration of 41,718 people in the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 75,991 persons, and internal migration resulted in a net loss of 34,273.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to 2005 estimates, Connecticut has moved from the 29th most populated state to the 30th.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to the 2018 estimates, the population of Connecticut is 3,572,665.

name: connecticut
sentence: 6.6% of the population were under 5 years of age, 24.7% were under 18 years of age and 13.8% were 65 years of age or older.

name: connecticut
sentence: Women accounted for approximately 51.6 per cent of the population, with 48.4 per cent of the population being boys.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1790, 97 per cent of the population of Connecticut was classified as "rural".

name: connecticut
sentence: The first census in which less than half the population was classified as rural dates back to 1890.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the 2000 census, only 12.3% were considered to be rural.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most of western and southern Connecticut (including the Gold Coast) is strongly associated with New York City

name: connecticut
sentence: The population centre of Connecticut is located in the town of Cheshire.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the 2010 United States Census, the percentages of race and ethnicity in Connecticut were as follows:

name: connecticut
sentence: Hispanics and Latinos of all races accounted for 13.4 per cent of the population at the 2010 census.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most populous ethnic group in the state is the non-Hispanic white group, but it increased from 98 per cent in 1940 to 71 per cent in 2010.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2004, 11.4 per cent of the population (400,000) was born abroad.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1870, home Americans accounted for 75 per cent of the state's population, but by 1918 it had fallen to 35 per cent.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2000, 81.69% of Connecticut residents aged 5 and over spoke English at home and 8.42% spoke Spanish, followed by Italian at 1.59%, French at 1.31% and Polish at 1.2%.

sentence: The main groups of European descent are:

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2011, 46.1% of the population of Connecticut under the age of 1 were minorities.

sentence: Note: Births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race, resulting in a higher overall number.

name: connecticut
sentence: The religious affiliations of the people of Connecticut in 2014:

name: connecticut
sentence: A Pew survey of religious self-identification of Connecticut residents showed the following distribution of affiliations: Protestants 35%, Mormonism 1%, Jews 3%, Roman Catholics 33%, Orthodox 1%, non-religious 28%, Jehovah's Witness 1%, Hinduism 1%, Buddhism 1% and Islam 1%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Jewish congregations had 108,280 members (3.2 per cent) in 2000.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Jewish population is concentrated in cities near Long Island Sound, between Greenwich and New Haven, in Greater New Haven and in Greater Hartford, especially in the suburbs of West Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to the Association of Religion Data Archives, the largest Christian denominations, according to the number of adherents, in 2010 were: the Catholic Church, with 1.252.936; the United Church of Christ, with 96.506; and non-denominational evangelical Protestants, with 72,863.

name: connecticut
sentence: Recent immigration has brought other non-Christian religions into the state, but the number of adherents of other religions is still low.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is also home to the largest Protestant church in New England: the first Cathedral in Bloomfield, Connecticut, Hartford County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hartford is the seat of the Catholic Archdiocese of Hartford, who is sovereign over the Diocese of Bridgeport and the Diocese of Norwich.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's economic output in 2019 as measured by gross domestic product was $289 billion, compared to $277.9 billion in 2018.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's personal income per capita in 2019 was estimated at $79,087, the highest of all states.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, there is a large disparity in income across the state; after New York, Connecticut had the second largest national difference between the average income of the highest 1 per cent and the lowest 99 per cent.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to a study conducted in 2018 by Phoenix Marketing International, Connecticut had the third largest number of millionaires per capita in the United States, with a ratio of 7.75%.

name: connecticut
sentence: New Canaan is the richest city in Connecticut with a per capita income of $85,459.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hartford is the poorest municipality in Connecticut with a per capita income of $13,428 in 2000.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of December 2019, Connecticut's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate was 3.8%, with an unemployment rate in the United States of America of 3.5% that month.

name: connecticut
sentence: Data from 1982 to 2000, Connecticut recorded its lowest unemployment rate in 2000 between August and October at 2.2%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest unemployment rate during this period occurred in November and December 2010 at 9.3%, but economists expect new record levels of layoffs to be registered following the closure of businesses in the spring of 2020 following the coronavirus pandemic.

name: connecticut
sentence: Tax is collected by the Revenue Service of Connecticut and local municipalities.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2012, after New York, Connecticut residents had the second highest government and local government tax rate, with 12.6% of income compared to the national average of 9.9%, as reported by the Tax Foundation.

name: connecticut
sentence: Prior to 1991, Connecticut had an income tax system reserved for investments.

name: connecticut
sentence: Employment income was not taxed, but investment income was taxed at 13%, the highest rate in the United States, without any deduction for the costs of producing investment income, such as interest on loans.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1991, under the authority of Governor Lowell P. Weicker Jr., an independent, the system was changed into a system in which taxes on employment income and investment income were equal to a maximum rate of 4%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The new tax policy attracted investment firms to Connecticut; in 2019, Fairfield County was home to 16 of the world's 200 largest hedge funds.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, Connecticut's personal income tax rates were divided into seven tax brackets of 3% (on income up to $10,000); 5% ($10,000 to $50,000); 5.5% ($50,000 to $100,000); 6% ($100,000 to $200,000); 6.5% ($200,000 to $250,000); 6.9% ($250,000 to $500,000) and 6.9% above $500,000, the additional amounts being due by band.

name: connecticut
sentence: All salaries of Connecticut residents are subject to State income tax, even if they are earned outside the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, in such cases, Connecticut's income tax should be withheld only to the extent that the Connecticut tax exceeds the amount withheld by the other administration.

name: connecticut
sentence: Since New York has higher income tax rates than Connecticut, this means that Connecticut residents working in New York do not have any Connecticut income tax withheld.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut allows for a credit for taxes paid to other jurisdictions, but as residents working in other states are still subject to Connecticut's income tax, they may owe taxes if the jurisdiction credit does not fully offset Connecticut's tax amount.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut collects a state sales tax of 6.35% on the retail sale, rental or rental of most goods.

name: connecticut
sentence: Certain articles and services in general are not subject to sales and use taxes unless they are specifically listed as being taxable by law.

name: connecticut
sentence: A provision excluding clothing less than $50 from sales tax was repealed on July 1, 2011.

name: connecticut
sentence: There is no additional sales tax imposed by the local authorities.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2001, Connecticut introduced what became an annual "holiday" sales tax every August of a week, when retailers do not have to pay sales tax on certain items and quantities of clothing that have varied from year to year.

name: connecticut
sentence: State law allows municipalities to tax property, including real property, vehicles and other personal property, with State law providing for exemptions, credits and varying allowances.

name: connecticut
sentence: All contributions are at 70% of fair market value.

name: connecticut
sentence: The maximum property tax credit is $200 per return and any surplus cannot be refunded or carried over.

name: connecticut

name: hawaii
sentence: The history of the Hawaiian economy can be traced by a succession of dominant industries: sandal, whaling, sugar cane, pineapple, military, tourism and education.

name: hawaii
sentence: Since the establishment of the State in 1959, tourism has been the largest sector, with 24.3% of gross domestic product (GDP) in 1997, despite diversification efforts.

sentence: Gross State output in 2003 amounted to US$ 47 billion; per capita income of Hawaiian residents in 2014 was US$ 54,516.

sentence: Hawaiian exports comprise food and clothing.

name: hawaii
sentence: These industries play a small role in the Hawaiian economy, due to maritime distance to viable markets, such as the contiguous west coast of the United States

name: hawaii
sentence: Government food exports include coffee, macadamia nuts, pineapple, cattle, sugar cane and honey.

name: hawaii
sentence: By weight, honey bees can be the most valuable export of the state.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to the Hawaii Agricultural Statistics Service, agricultural sales were US$370.9 million for diversified agriculture, US$100.6 million for pineapple and US$64.3 million for sugar cane.

sentence: Hawaii's relatively constant climate has attracted the seed industry, which is able to test three generations of crops a year on the islands, compared to one or two on the continent.

sentence: Seeds earned US$264 million in 2012, supporting 1,400 workers.

name: hawaii
sentence: The cost of living in Hawaii, especially Honolulu, is high compared to most major cities in the United States, although it is 6.7 per cent lower than in New York and 3.6 per cent lower than in San Francisco.

name: hawaii
sentence: These figures may not include certain costs, such as increased travel costs for flights, additional shipping costs and loss of promotional opportunities for customers outside the contiguous United States.
