name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian Electric Industries, a private company, provides 95 per cent of the state's population with electricity, mainly from fossil fuel plants.

name: hawaii
sentence: Average electricity prices in October 2014 (36.41 cents per kilowatt-hour) were almost three times higher than the national average (12.58 cents per kilowatt-hour) and 80% higher than the second highest state, Connecticut.

name: hawaii
sentence: The median value of housing in Hawaii at the 2000 Census was US$272,700, while the median national value of housing was US$119,600.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii home values were the highest in all states, including California, with a median value of US$211,500.

name: hawaii
sentence: Research by the National Association of Realtors places the 2010 median selling price of a single-family home in Honolulu, Hawaii, at US$607,600 and the US median selling price at US$173,200.

name: hawaii
sentence: The selling price of single-family homes in Hawaii was the highest of all U.S. cities in 2010, just above that of California's Silicon Valley region ($602,000).

name: hawaii
sentence: The very high cost of living in Hawaii is the result of several interrelated factors in the global economy, in addition to the US government's trade policy.

name: hawaii
sentence: Like other areas where weather conditions are desirable throughout the year, such as California, Arizona and Florida, Hawaii residents can be considered to be subject to a "sun tax".

name: hawaii
sentence: This situation is further compounded by the natural factors of geography and global distribution that lead to higher freight prices due to higher transport costs, a problem that also affects many island States and territories.

name: hawaii
sentence: The requirements of the Jones Act, which generally requires that goods be transported between locations within the United States, including between the west mainland coast of the United States and Hawaii, using only ships owned, constructed and crewed by the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: Ships complying with the Jones Act often cost more to build and operate than foreign ships, which can result in higher shipping costs.

name: hawaii
sentence: Although the Jones Act does not affect the transportation of goods to Hawaii directly from Asia, this type of trade is not common; this is mainly an economic consequence, including the additional costs associated with the stopover in Hawaii (e.g., in the United States).

name: hawaii
sentence: The size of the Hawaii market and the economy of using larger and larger vessels that cannot be handled in Hawaii for transoceanic voyages.

name: hawaii
sentence: As a result, Hawaii relies on the receipt of most incoming goods on qualified Jones Act vessels originating on the west coast of the United States, which can contribute to the increase in the cost of certain consumer goods and thus in the overall cost of living.

name: hawaii
sentence: Critics of the Jones Act argue that Hawaiian consumers ultimately bear the transportation costs of goods imposed by the Jones Act.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii's aboriginal culture is Polynesian.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii represents the northernmost extension of the vast Polynesian triangle of the south and central Pacific Ocean.

name: hawaii
sentence: While the traditional Hawaiian culture remains a vestige of modern Hawaiian society, ceremonies and traditions are renewed throughout the islands.

sentence: Some of these cultural influences, including the popularity (in a significantly modified form) of lûau and hula, are strong enough to affect the United States as a whole.

sentence: Hawaii's cuisine is a fusion of many foods brought by immigrants to the Hawaiian Islands, including early Polynesians and Hawaiian indigenous cuisine, as well as American, Chinese, Filipino, Japanese, Korean, Polynesian, Puerto Rican and Portuguese origins.

name: hawaii
sentence: Sources of plant and animal feed are imported from around the world for agricultural purposes into Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: Poi, a starch made by shelling the taro, is one of the traditional foods of the islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Many local restaurants serve the ubiquitous breakfast dish, which includes two rice scoops, a simplified version of American macaroni salad and a variety of garnishes, including hamburger paties, a fried egg, and a loco moco sauce, Japanese-style tonkatsu or traditional lûau dishes, including kālua pork and laula.

name: hawaii
sentence: The musubi spam is an example of the fusion of ethnic cuisine that has developed on the islands among the mixture of immigrant groups and military personnel.

name: hawaii
sentence: In the 1990s, a group of chefs developed the regional cuisine of Hawaii as a contemporary fusion cuisine.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some key customs and labels in Hawaii are as follows: when visiting a house, it is considered a good way to bring a small gift to its host (e.g., dessert).

sentence: Hawaiian mythology includes the legends, historical tales and dictates of the ancient Hawaiian people.

sentence: It is considered a variant of a more general Polynesian mythology that developed a unique character for centuries before around 1800.

sentence: The most important figures and terms are Aumakua, the spirit of an ancestor or god of the family and Kāne, the highest of the four great Hawaiian divinities.

name: hawaii
sentence: Polynesian mythology is the oral tradition of the Polynesian people, a grouping of island archipelagos of the Central Pacific Ocean and the South Pacific in the Polynesian triangle, as well as scattered cultures known as Polynesian outliers.

name: hawaii
sentence: Polynesians speak languages that descend from a reconstructed language under the name of protopolynesian who was probably spoken in the region around Tonga and Samoa in about 1000 B.C.

name: hawaii
sentence: Before the 15th century, Polynesians migrate eastward to the Cook Islands, and from there to other island groups such as Tahiti and the Marquesas.

sentence: There are also important cultural similarities between the different groups, in particular with regard to social organization, children's education, horticulture, construction and textile technologies.

sentence: Their mythologies in particular show local changes in common tales.

sentence: There are many Hawaiian State Parks.

sentence: Hawaii's literature is varied and includes authors Kiana Davenport, Lois-Ann Yamanaka and Kaui Hart Hemmings.

sentence: Hawaiian indigenous musician and Hawaiian sovereignty activist Israel Kamakawiwo-ole, famous for his melody of "Somewhere Over the Rainbow/What a Wonderful World", was named "The Voice of Hawaii" by NPR in 2010 in his series of 50 great voices.

sentence: The only NCAA Division I team in Hawaii is Hawaii Rainbow Warriors and Rainbow Wahine, who participate in the Big West Conference (main sports), the Mountain West Conference (football) and the Mountain Pacific Sports Federation (minor sports).

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has hosted the Sony Open Golf Tournament in Hawaii since 1965, the Champions' Tournament since 1999, the Lotte Golf Tournament since 2012, the Honolulu Marathon since 1973, the Ironman World Championship triathlon race since 1978, the Ultraman triathlon since 1983, the Pro Bowl of the National Football League from 1980 to 2016, the FINA 2000 World Open Water Swimming Championships and the 2008 Panpacific Championship and the 2012 Hawaii Islands Invitational Football Tournaments.

name: hawaii
sentence: Tourism is an important component of the Hawaiian economy.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 2003, according to government data, there were more than 6.4 million visitors, spending more than $10 billion on the Hawaiian Islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Due to mild weather all year round, tourism is popular throughout the year.

sentence: The main holidays are the most popular times for foreigners to visit, particularly during the winter months.

name: hawaii
sentence: A significant number of Japanese tourists are still visiting the islands but have now been overtaken by Chinese and Koreans due to the collapse of the Yen's value and the weakness of the Japanese economy.

name: hawaii
sentence: The average Japanese stay only five days, while the other Asian stay more than 9.5 days and spend 25% more.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii hosts numerous cultural events.

sentence: Honolulu hosts the state's long LGBT film festival, the Rainbow Film Festival.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 2009, Hawaii's health care system provides 92% of residents.

name: hawaii
sentence: Under the Government Plan, companies are required to provide insurance to employees who work more than 20 hours a week.

name: hawaii
sentence: Strong regulation of insurance companies helps to reduce costs for employers.

name: hawaii
sentence: Partly because of the emphasis on preventive care, Hawaiians need hospital care less frequently than the other United States, while total health expenditure as a percentage of government GDP is significantly lower.

name: hawaii
sentence: Supporters of universal health care elsewhere in the United States sometimes use Hawaii as a model for health care plans proposed by federal and state governments.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has the only unified state-wide school system in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is a state in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: It borders the state of Montana in the east and northeast, Wyoming in the east, Nevada and Utah in the south, and Washington and Oregon in the west.

name: idaho
sentence: To the north, it shares a small portion of Canada's border with British Columbia.

name: idaho
sentence: With a population of approximately 1.7 million and an area of 33,570 square miles (216,400 km2), Idaho is the 14th largest, the 12th least populated and the 7th least dense of the 50 American states.

name: idaho
sentence: The capital of the State and the largest city is Boise.

name: idaho
sentence: For thousands of years, Idaho has been inhabited by Amerindian peoples.

name: idaho
sentence: At the beginning of the 19th century, Idaho was considered part of Oregon, a disputed area between the United States and the British Empire.

name: idaho
sentence: It officially became American territory with the signing of the Oregon Treaty of 1846, but a separate territory from Idaho was only organized in 1863, instead of being included for periods in Oregon and Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho was finally admitted to the Union on 3 July 1890, becoming the 43rd state.

name: idaho
sentence: As part of the Pacific Northwest (and the Cascadia-associated bioregion), Idaho is divided into several distinct geographic and climatic regions.

name: idaho
sentence: The northern state, the relatively isolated Idaho Panhandle, is closely linked to the east of Washington with which it shares the Pacific Time Zone – the rest of the state uses the Mountain Time Zone.

name: idaho
sentence: The southern part of the state includes the Snake River Plain (which accounts for the majority of the population and agricultural land).

sentence: Industries important to the government economy include manufacturing, agriculture, mining, forestry and tourism.

name: idaho
sentence: A number of scientific and technological enterprises have their headquarters in Idaho or factories there, and the State also contains the National Laboratory of Idaho, which is the largest department of energy in the country.

name: idaho
sentence: The agricultural sector of Idaho provides many products, but the state is best known for its potato cultivation, which accounts for about one third of the national yield.

sentence: The official nickname of the State is "the State of Gem", which refers to the natural beauty of Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: The origin of the name remains a mystery.

name: idaho
sentence: In the early 1860s, when the U.S. Congress planned to organize a new territory in the Rocky Mountains, the name "Idaho" was suggested by George M. Willing, a politician who presented himself as an unrecognized delegate of the unofficial Jefferson territory.

name: idaho
sentence: Willing claimed that the name was derived from a Shoshone term meaning "the sun comes from the mountains" or "the name of the mountains", but it was later revealed that there was no such term and Willing claimed that he was inspired to give the name when he met a little girl named "Ida".

name: idaho
sentence: As the name seemed to be made, the U.S. Congress finally decided to appoint the Colorado Territory region instead when it was created in February 1861, but by the time that decision was made, the city of Idaho Springs, Colorado had already been named according to Willing's proposal.

name: idaho
sentence: That same year, Congress created the territory of Colorado, a county called Idaho County, in eastern Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: The county was named after a steam vessel called Idaho, which was launched on the Columbia River in 1860.

name: idaho

name: idaho
sentence: In any case, part of Washington's territory, including Idaho County, was used to create the Idaho Territory in 1863.

name: idaho
sentence: Finally, the name was given to the territory of Idaho, which later became the U.S. state.

name: idaho
sentence: Despite this lack of evidence for the origin of the name, many textbooks well during the 20th century repeated as Willing's narrative the name "Idaho" derived from the term Shoshone "ee-da-how".

sentence: The climate of Idaho varies widely.

name: idaho
sentence: Although the western border of the state is about 350 miles (560 km) from the Pacific Ocean, maritime influence is still felt in Idaho, especially in winter when cloud cover, humidity, and precipitation are at their peak.

name: idaho
sentence: This influence has a moderate effect in winter, where temperatures are not as low as might be expected in a northerly state where altitudes are mostly high.

name: idaho
sentence: Maritime influence is less pronounced in the eastern part of the state where rainfall is often reversed, with wetter summers and drier winters, and seasonal temperature differences are more extreme, showing a more semi-arid continental climate.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho may be warm, although long periods over 98°F (37°C) are rare, with the exception of the lowest point of altitude, Lewiston, who sees little snow as a result.

name: idaho
sentence: The warm summer days are tempered by low relative humidity and cooler evenings during the summer months since, for most states, the greatest diurnal temperature difference is often in summer.

name: idaho
sentence: Winters may be cold, although long periods of bitter cold below zero are unusual.

name: idaho
sentence: The highest Idaho temperature of 118°F (48°C) was recorded at Orofino on 28 July 1934; the lowest Idaho temperature of -60°F (−51°C) was recorded at the Island Park Dam on 18 January 1943.

name: idaho

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's main agricultural products are maize, soybeans, pigs, livestock, dairy products and wheat.

sentence: Illinois is a leader in the manufacture and processing of food.

name: illinois
sentence: Approximately three-quarters of government manufacturers are located in the Northeastern Opportunity Return area, with 38% of the approximately 18,900 Illinois manufacturing plants located in Cook County.

name: illinois

sentence: The majority of the coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states and countries.

sentence: In 2008, Illinois exported three million tons of coal and is expected to export nine million tons of coal in 2011, with energy demand increasing in places such as China, India and other countries in Asia and Europe.

name: illinois

name: illinois

sentence: Historically, Illinois was a state with political infancy, whose quasi-parity existed between the republican and democratic parties.

sentence: Three presidents claimed Illinois as their political basis when they came to the presidency: Abraham Lincoln, Ulysses S. Grant and more recently Barack Obama.

sentence: He sat in the General Assembly and represented the 7th District of Congress in the United States House of Representatives before his election to the presidency in 1860.

sentence: Ulysse S. Grant was born in Ohio and had a military career that prevented him from settling, but on the eve of the Civil War and as the Middle Ages approached, he moved to Illinois and thus used the state as his home and political base to run for office.

sentence: Barack Obama was born in Hawaii and made Illinois his home after graduating from law school and then represented Illinois in the U.S. Senate.

sentence: The Daley family power base was in Chicago.

sentence: The Pritzker family is based in Chicago and has played an important role both in the private and public sectors.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Education Council (ISBE) is autonomous from the Governor and the legislature of the state, and administers public education in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Local municipalities and their respective school districts operate individual public schools, but the ISBE checks the performance of public schools with the Illinois School Report Card.

name: illinois
sentence: ISBE also makes recommendations to state leaders on education expenditures and policies.

name: illinois
sentence: Education is compulsory for children aged 7 to 17 in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Schools are usually, but not exclusively, divided into three levels of primary and secondary education: primary school, college or college, and high school.

name: illinois
sentence: District territories are often complex in structure.

name: illinois
sentence: Many regions of the State are in fact located in two school districts, one for secondary schools and the other for primary and secondary schools.

name: illinois
sentence: And such districts don't necessarily share borders.

name: illinois
sentence: A given secondary school may have several elementary districts that feed on it, but some of these districts may themselves feed in several districts of secondary schools.

name: illinois
sentence: Using the criterion established by the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Education, there are eleven "national universities" in the State.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Chicago is consistently ranked as one of the top ten universities in the world in various independent academic rankings, and its Booth School of Business, as well as the Kellogg School of Management in Northwestern, consistently rank among the top five business schools in the country and top ten in the world.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Illinois in Urbana–Champaign is often ranked among the best engineering schools in the world and in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: As of August 19, 2010, six of them are ranked "first" among the top 500 national universities in the country, according to the rankings of the US News & World Report: University of Chicago, University of Northwestern, University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, University of Loyola Chicago, Illinois Institute of Technology, University of DePaul, University of Illinois at Chicago, State University of Illinois, University of Southern Illinois Carbondale and University of Northern Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has over twenty other four-year-old accredited universities, both public and private, as well as dozens of small liberal arts colleges across the state.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, Illinois supports 49 public community colleges at the Illinois Community College System.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois schools are financed primarily by property tax, based on the assessment of land value by the state, rather than by direct government contributions.

name: illinois
sentence: Tracy Steffes described Illinois's public education as historically "inequitable", a system where one of the "richest states" is "the brightest in its support for education."There have been several attempts to reform school funding in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The most notable attempt took place in 1973 with the adoption of the Illinois Resource Equalizer Formula, a measure in which it was hoped that funding could be collected and distributed more equitably to schools in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: However, opposition from the well-off Illinois communities who opposed the obligation to pay for the less well-off school districts (including many black-majority communities, produced by redline, white flight and other "soft" segregation methods) led to the abolition of formulae in the late 1980s.

name: illinois
sentence: Because of its central location and proximity to the Rust Belt and Grain Belt, Illinois is a national hub for air, automobile, rail and road traffic.

name: illinois
sentence: From 1962 to 1998, the O'Hare International Airport in Chicago (ORD) is the busiest airport in the world, measured both in terms of flights and passengers.

name: illinois
sentence: While it was surpassed by Hartsfield of Atlanta in 1998 (as Chicago divides its air traffic between O'Hare and Midway airports, while Atlanta uses only one airport), with 59.3 million national passengers per year, as well as 11.4 million international passengers in 2008, O'Hare remains one of the two or three most frequented airports in the world, and in some years still ranks first in total flights.

name: illinois
sentence: This is a major hub for United Airlines and American Airlines, and a major airport expansion project is currently underway.

name: illinois
sentence: The Midway Airport (MDW), which had been the busiest airport in the world at some point until it was supplanted by O'Hare as the busiest airport in 1962, is now the secondary airport in the Chicago metropolitan area and still ranks as one of the busiest airports in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Midway is a major centre for Southwest Airlines and serves many other carriers.

name: illinois
sentence: Midway served 17.3 million domestic and international passengers in 2008.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has an extensive network of rail passenger and freight transportation.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is a national centre in Amtrak and passengers in the state are served by Amtrak's Illinois Service, with Chicago in Carbondale Illini and Saluki, Chicago in Quincy Carl Sandburg and Illinois Zephyr, and Chicago in St. Louis Lincoln Service.

name: illinois
sentence: Currently, work is underway on the Chicago–St.

name: illinois
sentence: Louis Line to increase the maximum speed to 110 mph (180 km/h), which would reduce travel time by one and a half hours.

name: illinois
sentence: Nearly all North American railways meet in Chicago, making it the largest and most active railway centre in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: A large suburban train is supplied in the city itself and in some immediate suburbs by the "L" system of the Chicago Transit Authority.

name: illinois
sentence: One of the largest suburban rail networks in the United States, operated by Metra, uses existing rail lines to provide direct access to hundreds of suburbs to the city and beyond.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition to state rail lines, Mississippi and Illinois provide important transportation routes for the state's agricultural interests.

name: illinois
sentence: Lake Michigan provides Illinois with access to the Atlantic Ocean via the St. Lawrence Seaway.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's interstate highways are all segments of the interstate highway network that are owned and maintained by the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has the distinction of having the most primary (two-digit) interstates pass through it among the 50 states with 13.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also ranks third among the 50 states with the most interstate mileage, coming after California and Texas, which are much larger states in the region.

name: illinois
sentence: The major American interstate highways that cross the state include: Interstate 24 (I-24), I-39, I-41, I-55, I-57, I-64, I-70, I-72, I-74, I-80, I-88, I-90 and I-94.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois Department of Transportation (IDOT) is responsible for the maintenance of the USHighways in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois system consists of 21 primary highways.

name: illinois
sentence: The U.S. highways that cross the state include the United States 6, the United States 12, the United States 14, the United States 20, the United States 24, the United States 30, the United States 34, the United States 36, the United States 40, the United States 41, the United States 45, the United States 50, the United States 51, the United States 52, the United States 54, the United States 60, the United States 62 and the United States 67.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana () is an American state located in the Midwest and Great Lakes regions of North America.

name: indiana
sentence: It is the 38th largest per region and the 17th most populous of the 50 United States.

name: indiana
sentence: Its capital and largest city is Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was admitted to the United States as the 19th state on December 11, 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: It borders Lake Michigan to the northwest, Michigan to the north, Ohio to the east, Ohio River and Kentucky to the south and southeast, and Wabash River and Illinois to the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Before becoming a territory, various Aboriginal peoples have lived in Indiana for thousands of years.

name: indiana
sentence: Since its founding as a territory, settlement models in Indiana have reflected regional cultural segmentation in the eastern United States; the northernmost level of the state has been established primarily by residents of New England and New York, Central Indiana by migrants from the states of Mid-Atlantic and adjacent Ohio, and Southern Indiana by settlers from southern states, particularly Kentucky and Tennessee.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a diversified economy with a gross government product of $359.12 billion in 2017.

name: indiana
sentence: It has several metropolitan areas with more than 100,000 inhabitants and a number of small industrial cities.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana hosts professional sports teams, including the NFL's Indianapolis Colts and the NBA's Indiana Pacers, and hosts several outstanding competition events, including the Indianapolis 500.

name: indiana
sentence: The name Indiana means "Indian Land", or simply "Indian Land".

name: indiana
sentence: It is also a result of Indiana's territorial history.

name: indiana
sentence: On May 7, 1800, the United States Congress passed a law to divide the Northwest Territory into two areas and named the western section of the Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1816, when Congress passed enabling legislation to begin the process of establishing the state for Indiana, part of that land became the geographic area of the new state.

name: indiana
sentence: An Indiana resident is officially known as a Hoosier.

name: indiana
sentence: The etymology of this word is contested, but the main theory, put forward by the Indiana Historical Bureau and the Indiana Historical Society, has its origin in Virginia, the Carolinas, and Tennessee (the South of Upland) as a term for a backwoodsman, a rough peasant, or a blockkin of countries.

name: indiana
sentence: The first inhabitants of what is now Indiana were the Paleo-Indians, who arrived about 8,000 B.C. after melting glaciers at the end of the ice age.

name: indiana
sentence: Divided into small groups, the Paleo-Indians were nomads who hunted large game like mastodons.

name: indiana
sentence: They have created stone tools made of chert in chips, crunching and flocking.

name: indiana
sentence: The archaic period, which began between 5000 and 4000 BC, covered the next phase of Aboriginal culture.

name: indiana
sentence: The people have developed new tools and techniques to cook food, an important step in civilization.

name: indiana
sentence: These new tools included different types of spear tips and knives, with various types of notches.

name: indiana
sentence: They made ground stone tools such as stone axes, woodworking tools, and grinding stones.

name: indiana
sentence: During the latter part of the period, they built earth mounds and middens, showing that settlements became more permanent.

name: indiana
sentence: The archaic period ended at about 1500 BC, although some archaic people lived up to 700 BC.

name: indiana
sentence: The Woodland period began around 1500 BC, when new cultural attributes appeared.

name: indiana
sentence: People created ceramics and pottery, and expanded their plant cultivation.

name: indiana
sentence: An early Woodland group named the Adena people had elegant burial rituals, with log tombs beneath the earth mounds.

name: indiana
sentence: In the middle of the Woodlands period, the Hopewells began to develop long-distance merchandise trade.

name: indiana
sentence: Towards the end of the stage, people developed a highly productive crop and the adaptation of agriculture, cultivating crops such as corn and squash.

name: indiana
sentence: The Woodland period ended around 1000 AD.

name: indiana
sentence: The Mississippi culture was born from 1000 AD until the 15th century, shortly before the arrival of Europeans.

name: indiana
sentence: During this stage, people created large urban agglomerations designed according to their cosmology, with large mounds and squares defining ceremonial and public spaces.

name: indiana
sentence: The concentrated settlements were dependent on agricultural surpluses.

name: indiana
sentence: One of those complexes was the Angel Mounds.

name: indiana
sentence: They had vast public spaces, such as squares and platform mounds, where leaders lived or conducted rituals.

name: indiana
sentence: Mississippi civilization collapsed in Indiana in the mid-15th century for reasons that remain uncertain.

name: indiana
sentence: The historic Amerindian tribes of the region, at the time of the European meeting, spoke different languages of the Algonquian family.

name: indiana
sentence: They included Shawnee, Miami, and Illini.

name: indiana
sentence: The refugee tribes of the eastern regions, including the Delawares who settled in the White and Whitewater River valleys, joined them later.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1679, the French explorer René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle, was the first European to cross Indiana after reaching the Bend Sud at the Saint Joseph River.

name: indiana
sentence: He returned the following year to learn about the region.

name: indiana
sentence: The French-Canadian fur traders arrived soon, bringing blankets, jewellery, tools, whisky and weapons for the trade of hides with the Amerindians.

name: indiana
sentence: As early as 1702, Sieur Juchereau established the first bargaining position near Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1715 Sieur de Vincennes built Fort Miami in Kekionga, now Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1717, another Canadian, Picote de Beletre, built Fort Ouitatinon on the Wabash River, trying to control the Amerindian trade routes from Lake Erie to the Mississippi River.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1732 Sieur de Vincennes built a second fur trade post in Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: The French Canadian settlers, who had left the previous post as a result of the hostilities, returned in more numbers.

name: indiana
sentence: In a few years, British settlers arrived from the east and opposed Canadians to control the lucrative fur trade.

name: indiana
sentence: The fighting between French and British settlers took place throughout the 1750s.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's Amerindian tribes allied themselves with French Canadians during the French and Indian War (also known as the Seven Years' War).

name: indiana
sentence: With the British victory in 1763, the French were forced to yield to the British crown all their lands in North America east of Mississippi and north and west of the colonies.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana tribes did not give up: they seized Fort Ouiatnon and Fort Miami during the Pontiac rebellion.

name: indiana
sentence: The British Royal Proclamation of 1763 designated the land west of the Appalachians for Amerindian purposes, and excluded British settlers in the area that the Crown called "Indian territory."

name: indiana
sentence: In 1775 the American Revolutionary War began when the settlers sought British autonomy and independence.

name: indiana
sentence: The majority of the fighting took place near the east coast, but Patriotic military officer George Rogers Clark called an army to help fight the British in the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Clark's army won major battles and took Vincennes and Fort Sackville back on 25 Feb. 1779.

name: indiana
sentence: During the war, Clark managed to cut off British troops, who attacked the settlers from the east from the west.

name: indiana
sentence: His success is often attributed to changing the course of the American Revolutionary War.

name: indiana
sentence: At the end of the war, through the Treaty of Paris, the British Crown ceded its rights to land south of the Great Lakes to the newly formed United States, including Amerindian lands.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1787, the United States defined the Northwest Territory, which included the present Indiana region.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1800 Congress separated Ohio from the Northwest Territory, designating the remainder of the lands as Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: President Thomas Jefferson chose William Henry Harrison as the Territory's governor, and Vincennes was established as the capital.

name: indiana
sentence: After the separation of Michigan territory and the formation of Illinois territory, Indiana is reduced to its present size and geography.

name: indiana
sentence: From the battle of the woods fallen in 1794 and the Treaty of Greenville in 1795, Native American titles on Indiana lands were extinguished by usurpation, purchase or war and processed.

name: indiana
sentence: About half the state was acquired in the Treaty of St. Mary's of Miami in 1818.

name: indiana
sentence: Purchases were not completed until the Treaty of Mississinewas, in 1826, acquired the last of the American native lands reserved in the northeast.

name: indiana
sentence: Portrait of the Indiana Border Around 1810: The boundary was defined by the Treaty of Fort Wayne in 1809, adding much of the southwestern lands around Vincennes and the southeast lands adjacent to Cincinnati, to areas along Ohio as part of American territory.

name: indiana
sentence: The colonies were military outposts such as Fort Ouiatinon in the northwest and Fort Miami (later Fort Wayne) in the northeast, Fort Knox, and the Vincennes settlement in the lower Wabash.

name: indiana
sentence: Other settlements included Clarksville (through Louisville), Vevay and Corydon along the Ohio River, Quaker Colony at Richmond on the east border, and Conner's Post (later Connersville) on the east central border.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis would not be populated for another 15 years, and the territory of Central and Northern Indiana remained a wilderness inhabited primarily by indigenous communities.

name: indiana
sentence: Only two counties in the far southeast, Clark and Dearborn, had been organized by European settlers.

name: indiana
sentence: Land titles issued from Cincinnati were few.

name: indiana
sentence: Settler migration takes place mainly by flat boat on the Ohio River to the west, and by car paths to the Wabash/White River valleys (west) and Whitewater River (east).

name: indiana
sentence: In 1810, tribal leader Shawnee Tecumseh and his brother Tenskwatawa encouraged other Aboriginal tribes in the territory to resist European colonization.

name: indiana
sentence: Tensions rose and the United States authorized Harrison to launch a preventive expedition against the Tecumseh Confederation; the United States won at the Battle of Tippecanoe on November 7, 1811.

name: indiana
sentence: Tecumseh was killed in 1813 during the battle of Thames.

name: indiana
sentence: After his death, armed resistance to United States control ended in the region.

name: indiana
sentence: Most of the Amerindian tribes of the state were subsequently abducted west of Mississippi in the 1820s and 1830s after the American negotiations and the purchase of their land.

name: indiana
sentence: Corydon, a town in the extreme south of Indiana, was named the second capital of Indiana territory in May 1813 to reduce the threat of Indian raids following the Battle of Tippecanoe.

name: indiana
sentence: Two years later, a petition for state status was approved by the territorial general assembly and sent to Congress.

name: indiana
sentence: Enabling legislation has been enacted to allow for the election of delegates to draft a constitution for Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: On 10 June 1816, delegates gathered in Corydon to draft the constitution, which was completed in 19 days.

name: indiana
sentence: Jonathan Jennings was elected the first governor of the nascent state in August 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 11, 1816, President James Madison approved the admission of Indiana to the union as the nineteenth state.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1825 the state capital was moved from Corydon to Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Many European immigrants went west to settle in Indiana at the beginning of the 19th century.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest group of immigrants to Indiana were the Germans, as well as many immigrants from Ireland and England.

name: indiana
sentence: Americans who were predominantly English-born migrated from northern New York and New England, as well as from the mid-Atlantic state of Pennsylvania.

name: indiana
sentence: The arrival of steamboats on the Ohio River in 1811 and the National Road at Richmond in 1829 greatly facilitated the settlement of northern and western Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: After the creation of a state, the new government worked to transform Indiana from a border into a developed, well-populated and prosperous state, starting with major demographic and economic changes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1836, the founders of the state launched a program, the Indiana Mammouth Internal Improvement Act, which led to the construction of government-funded roads, canals, railways and public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: The plans went bankrupt to the state and were a financial disaster, but increased the land and produced more than four times the value.

name: indiana
sentence: In response to the crisis and to avoid another, a second constitution was adopted in 1851.

name: indiana
sentence: Among its provisions was the prohibition of public debt, as well as the extension of the vote to Afro-Americans.

name: indiana
sentence: During the American civil war, Indiana became politically influential and played an important role in the affairs of the nation.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was the first Western state to mobilize for the United States in the war, and Indiana soldiers participated in all the main commitments of the war.

name: indiana
sentence: The state provided the Union with 126 infantry regiments, 26 artillery batteries and 13 cavalry regiments.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1861, Indiana received a contingent of 7,500 troops to join the Union Army.

name: indiana
sentence: Both volunteers in the first appeal and thousands had to be rejected.

name: indiana
sentence: Before the end of the war, Indiana had supplied 208,367 men.

name: indiana
sentence: Of these men, more than 35% lost their lives: 24,416 lost their lives and more than 50,000 were injured.

name: indiana
sentence: The only civil war conflicts fought in Indiana were the Newburgh Raid, a bloodless capture of the city; and the Battle of Corydon, which took place during the Morgan Raid, leaving 15 dead, 40 wounded, and 355 captured.

name: indiana
sentence: After the war, Indiana remained an essentially agricultural state.

name: indiana
sentence: Post-war industries included mining, including limestone extraction, meat packaging, food processing, such as grain grinding, distillation into alcohol, and the construction of cars, bugs, agricultural machinery and equipment.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the discovery of natural gas in the 1880s in northern Indiana led to an economic boom: the abundant and cheap fuel attracted heavy industry; the availability of jobs in turn attracted new settlers from other parts of the country as well as Europe.

name: indiana
sentence: This has led to the rapid expansion of cities such as South Bend, Gary, Indianapolis and Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: With the start of the industrial revolution, Indian industry began to grow at an accelerated pace in the northern part of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: With industrialization, workers have developed trade unions and electoral movements in relation to women's progress.

name: indiana
sentence: At the beginning of the 20th century, Indiana became a strong manufacturing state linked to the new automotive industry.

name: indiana
sentence: Haynes-Apperson, the country's first commercially successful automotive company, operated in Kokomo until 1925.

name: indiana
sentence: The construction of the Indianapolis Highway and the start-up of automotive-related industries were also linked to the growth of the automotive industry.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1930s, Indiana, like the rest of the nation, was hit by the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: The economic slowdown has had a significant negative impact on Indiana, such as the decline in urbanization.

name: indiana
sentence: The Dust Bowl further west led many migrants to flee to the more industrialized Midwest.

name: indiana
sentence: Governor Paul V. McNutt's administration found it difficult to build a publicly funded social assistance system to assist overcrowded private charities.

name: indiana
sentence: During its administration, spending and taxes were significantly reduced in response to the depression, and the state government was completely reorganized.

name: indiana
sentence: McNutt terminated the state ban and passed the first state income tax.

name: indiana
sentence: On several occasions, he declared martial law to put an end to labour strikes.

name: indiana
sentence: The Second World War helped to revive the Indiana economy, as the war required steel, food and other goods that were produced in the state.

name: indiana
sentence: About ten per cent of Indiana's population joined the armed forces, while hundreds of industries won war production contracts and began manufacturing war equipment.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana manufactured 4.5 per cent of the total U.S. military weapons produced during the Second World War, ranking eighth among the 48 states.

name: indiana
sentence: The expansion of industry to meet the demands of war has helped to end the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: At the end of the Second World War, Indiana returned to pre-Depression production levels.

name: indiana
sentence: Industry became the main employer, a trend that continued in the 1960s.

name: indiana
sentence: Urbanisation in the 1950s and 1960s led to substantial growth in government cities.

name: indiana
sentence: The automotive, steel and pharmaceutical industries dominated major Indiana companies.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana population continued to grow after the war, exceeding five million people according to the 1970 census.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1960s, Matthew E. Welsh's administration adopted its first two percent sales tax.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana schools were disintegrated in 1949.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1950, the Census Bureau reported that the Indian population was 95.5% white and 4.4% black.

name: indiana
sentence: The Welsh Governor also collaborated with the General Assembly on the adoption of the Indiana Civil Rights Bill, which provides equal protection to minorities seeking employment.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 8, 1964, a Convair B-58 carrying nuclear weapons slipped onto an ice track on the basis of the Bunker Hill Air Force in Bunker Hill, Indiana, and caught fire during a training exercise.

name: indiana
sentence: The five nuclear weapons on board were burned, including a thermonuclear weapon of 9 megatonnes, causing radioactive contamination of the accident area.

name: indiana
sentence: Starting in 1970, a series of amendments to the constitution of the State were proposed.

name: indiana
sentence: With the adoption, the Indiana Court of Appeal was established and the procedure for appointing judges changed.

name: indiana
sentence: The 1973 oil crisis created a recession that affected the automobile industry in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Companies such as Delco Electronics and Delphi have begun a long series of cuts that have contributed to high unemployment rates in manufacturing in Anderson, Muncie and Kokomo.

name: indiana
sentence: The trend towards restructuring and deindustrialization continued until the 1980s, when the national and state economy began to diversify and recover.

name: indiana
sentence: With a total land and water area of 36,418 square miles (94,320 km2), Indiana ranks 38th among the largest states.

name: indiana
sentence: The State has a maximum northern dimension to the south of 250 miles (400 kilometres) and a maximum east-west dimension of 145 miles (233 kilometres).

name: indiana
sentence: The geographical centre of the state (39° 53.7'N, 86° 16.0W) is located in Marion County.

name: indiana
sentence: Located in the Midwest of the United States, Indiana is one of eight states that make up the Great Lakes region.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is bordered to the north by Michigan, to the east by Ohio, and to the west by Illinois, partially separated by the Wabash River.

name: indiana
sentence: Lake Michigan borders Indiana in the northwest, and the Ohio River separates Indiana from Kentucky in the south.

name: indiana
sentence: The average altitude of Indiana is about 760 feet (230 metres) above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The highest point in the state is Hoosier Hill in Wayne County 1,257 feet (383 m) above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The lowest point at 320 feet (98 m) above sea level is in Posey County where the Wabash River meets the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: The resulting elevation range of 937 feet (286 m) is the narrowest of any U.S. non-coastal state.

name: indiana
sentence: Only 2,850 square miles (7,400 square kilometres) are above 1,000 feet (300 metres) and the area is closed in 14 counties.

name: indiana
sentence: Approximately 4,700 square miles (12,000 km2) have an altitude of less than 500 feet (150 m), mainly concentrated along Ohio and the lower Wabash, Tell City and Terre Haute valleys at Evansville and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: The state comprises two natural regions of the United States: the central lowlands and the inner lowlands.

name: indiana
sentence: The till plains are the northern and central areas of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: A large part of its appearance is the result of elements left behind by glaciers.

name: indiana
sentence: The centre of Indiana is mostly flat with a few low hilly hills (except when rivers cut deep valleys across the plain, such as the Wabash River and Sugar Creek) and ground composed of glacial sands, gravel and clay, giving rise to exceptional agricultural land.

name: indiana
sentence: Northern Indiana is similar, except for higher and more hilly terminal moraines and hundreds of kettle lakes.

name: indiana
sentence: In northwestern Indiana, there are various sand ridges and dunes, some of which are nearly 200 feet high.

name: indiana
sentence: It is along the shore of Lake Michigan and the interior of the Kankakee Outwash Plain.

name: indiana
sentence: Southern Indiana is characterized by rugged and hilly valleys and terrain that contrast with much of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Here, the substrate is exposed to the surface and is not buried in the glacier until further north.

name: indiana
sentence: Due to Indiana limestone, the area has numerous caves, caves and quarries.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's main river systems include the Whitewater, White, Blue, Wabash, St. Joseph and Maumee rivers.

name: indiana
sentence: According to the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, there were 65 rivers, streams and streams of environmental interest or picturesque beauty, which included only a portion of approximately 24,000 hydrographic miles in total in the state.

name: indiana
sentence: The Wabash River, which is the longest open river east of Mississippi, is the official Indiana River.

name: indiana
sentence: At 475 miles (764 kilometres) long, the river bisects the state from northeast to southwest, forming part of the state border with Illinois, before converging with the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: The river was the subject of several songs, such as On the Banks of the Wabash, The Wabash Cannonball and Back Home Again, In Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: There are about 900 lakes registered by the Indiana Ministry of Natural Resources.

name: indiana
sentence: To the northwest, Indiana borders Lake Michigan, one of five lakes including the Great Lakes, the largest group of freshwater lakes in the world.

name: indiana
sentence: Tippecanoe Lake, the deepest lake in the state, reaches depths of nearly 37 metres, while Wawassee Lake is the largest natural lake in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: At 10 750 acres (summer pool level), Lake Monroe is the largest lake in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: In the past, almost all of Indiana had a humid continental climate, with cold winters and warm and humid summers; only the extreme south of the state was in the humid subtropical climate, which receives more precipitation than other parts of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: But since the 2016 update, about half of the state has now been classified as subtropical wet.

name: indiana
sentence: Temperatures are generally different from the northern and southern sections of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: In mid-winter, mean high/low temperatures vary from 30°F/15°F (−1°C/−10°C) to the extreme north at 41°F/24°F (5°C/−4°C) in the extreme south.

name: indiana
sentence: In mid-summer, there is generally slightly less variation in the state, as average high/low temperatures vary from about 84 °F/64 °F (29 °C/18 °C) to the extreme north at 90 °F/69 °F (32 °C/21 °C) to the extreme south.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's record temperature was 116°F (47°C) set on July 14, 1936 at Collegeville.

name: indiana

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a constitutional form of democratic republican government with three branches: the executive, including an elected governor and a lieutenant governor; the legislature, consisting of an elected bicameral general assembly; and the judiciary, the Supreme Court of Indiana, the Indiana Court of Appeal and the circuit courts.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor of Indiana is the chief executive of the state and has the power to administer the government as set out in the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor and the Lieutenant Governor are jointly elected for a four-year term, with government elections held in parallel with the American presidential elections (1996, 2000, 2004, 2008, etc.).

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor shall not serve more than two consecutive terms.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor works with the Indiana General Assembly and the Indiana Supreme Court to govern the state and has the power to adjust the other branches.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor may convene special sessions of the General Assembly and select and revoke the leaders of almost all departments, councils and State commissions.

name: indiana
sentence: Other notable powers include the appeal to the Indiana Guard Reserve or the Indiana National Guard in case of emergency or disaster, the issuance of a pardon or commutation of the sentence of any criminal offender, except in cases of treason or indictment, and the possession of abundant legal authority.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor acts as Speaker of the Senate and ensures that the rules of the Senate are respected by its electors.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor only votes when necessary to break ties.

name: indiana
sentence: If the Governor dies in office, becomes permanently unfit, resigns or is charged, the Lieutenant Governor becomes Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: If the positions of Governor and Lieutenant Governor are not occupied, Senator President pro tempore becomes Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana General Assembly consists of a 50-member senator and a 100-member House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: The Senate is the upper house of the General Assembly and the House of Representatives is the lower house.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly has exclusive legislative power within the government of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: The honourable senator and the House may introduce a bill, except for the fact that the senator is not authorized to pass a bill that will have an impact on revenues.

name: indiana
sentence: Bills are debated and passed separately in each chamber, but both chambers must pass them before they can be submitted to the governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The legislator may cancel the Governor's veto by a majority vote of full members in the Senate and in the House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: Each law adopted by the General Assembly must be used without exception for the State as a whole.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly does not have the power to create legislation aimed at a particular community.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly can manage the state's judicial system by organizing the size of the courts and the boundaries of their constituencies.

name: indiana
sentence: It can also oversee the activities of the executive power of the state government, has limited the power to regulate county governments within the state, and has the exclusive power to initiate the method of amending the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana Supreme Court consists of five judges and a 15-judge Court of Appeal.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor selects the judges of the Supreme Courts and Appeals Courts from a group of candidates selected by a special commission.

name: indiana
sentence: After two years of service, judges must obtain support from the electorate to serve for a 10-year term.

name: indiana
sentence: In almost all cases, the Supreme Court does not have original jurisdiction and can only hear cases submitted to it after the hearing of the lower courts.

name: indiana
sentence: Local circuit courts are where most cases begin with a trial and the consequences are decided by the jury.

name: indiana
sentence: The Supreme Court has original and unique jurisdiction in certain areas, including the practice of law, discipline or exclusion of judges appointed to the lower courts of the State, and the control of the exercise of jurisdiction by other lower courts of the State.

name: indiana

sentence: Despite its dependence on manufacturing, Indiana was less affected by the decline in traditional Rust Belt manufacturing than many of its neighbours.

sentence: The explanation appears to be some of the factors in the labour market.

name: indiana
sentence: First, a large part of heavy manufacturing, such as industrial machinery and steel, requires a highly skilled workforce, and companies are often willing to locate where there are already skills that are difficult to train.

sentence: This allows companies to offer wages somewhat lower than those normally paid for these skills.

sentence: A long-standing proposal to transform Gary Chicago International Airport into the third major Chicago airport received a boost in early 2006, with $48 million in federal funding approved over the next 10 years.
