sentence: There are no airlines operating from the Terre Haute regional airport, but it is used for private aircraft.

name: indiana
sentence: Since 1954, 181 Wing of the Indiana National Air Guard has been stationed there, but the 2005 Re-alignment and Closure Base (BRAC) proposal indicated that the 181st would lose its fighter mission and F-16 aircraft, leaving a combat aircraft facility at the Terre Haute facility.

name: indiana
sentence: Louisville International Airport, opposite the Ohio River in Louisville, Kentucky, serves southern Indiana, as well as Cincinnati/North Kentucky International Airport in Hebron, Kentucky.

name: indiana
sentence: Many residents of Northwest Indiana, primarily in the Chicago metropolitan area, use Chicago airports, O'Hare International Airport, and Chicago Midway International Airport.

name: indiana
sentence: The major American interstate highways in Indiana are I-64, I-65, I-265, I-465, I-865, I-69, I-469, I-70, I-74, I-80, I-90, I-94 and I-275.

name: indiana
sentence: The various roads that intersect in and around Indianapolis, as well as its historical status as a railway hub, and the canals that crossed Indiana, are the source of the state's motto, the crossroad of America.

name: indiana
sentence: There are also many U.S. highways and public highways maintained by the Indiana Department of Transportation.

name: indiana
sentence: These are numbered according to the same convention as the United States.

name: indiana
sentence: The roads.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana allows highways of different classifications to have the same number.

name: indiana
sentence: For example, I-64 and Indiana State Road 64 both exist (rather close to each other) in Indiana, but are separate roads with no relationship to each other.

name: indiana
sentence: A $3 billion project for period I-69 is under way.

name: indiana
sentence: The project has been divided into six sections, the first five of which (relating Evansville to Martinsville) have now been completed.

name: indiana
sentence: The sixth and final phase of Indianapolis is under planning.

name: indiana
sentence: Once completed, I-69 will cross 142 additional miles (229 km) across the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Indiana counties use a network-based system to identify county roads; this system has replaced the old arbitrary system of road numbers and names, and (among other things) it is much easier to identify call sources placed in the 9-1-1 system.

name: indiana
sentence: These systems are easier to implement in the glacially flattened northern and central parts of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Rural counties in the southern third of the state are less likely to have grids and more likely to depend on non-systematic road names (e.g., Crawford, Harrison, Perry, Scott and Washington counties).

name: indiana
sentence: There are also counties in the northern parts of the state that have never set up a grid or implemented only part of it.

name: indiana
sentence: Some counties are also located in a grid system that is almost similar to that of diamonds (e.g. Clark, Floyd, Gibson and Knox counties).

name: indiana
sentence: Such a system is also almost unnecessary in these situations.

name: indiana
sentence: One day, Knox County used two different network systems for county roads because the county was built using two different surveying systems, but it has since decided to use the road names and to combine the roads instead.

name: indiana
sentence: In particular, the county road network of St. Joseph County, the main city of which is South Bend, uses perennial names (trees) (i.e., trees).

name: indiana
sentence: Ashes, Hickory, Ironwood, etc.)

name: indiana
sentence: In alphabetical order of north-south roads and presidential names and other notable names (i.e. Adams, Edison, Lincoln Way, etc.)

name: indiana
sentence: in alphabetical order of east-west roads.

name: indiana
sentence: Exceptions to this rule exist in downtown South Bend and Mishawaka.

name: indiana
sentence: The east-west roads of Hamilton County continue the numbered Indianapolis street network from 96th Street to Marion County Line to 296th Street at Tipton County Line.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has over 4,255 miles of track, 91 per cent of which are operated by Class I railways, primarily CSX Transportation and Norfolk Southern Railway.

name: indiana
sentence: Other Class I railways in Indiana include the National Railway of Canada and the Soo Line Railway, a subsidiary of the Canadian Pacific Railway, as well as Amtrak.

name: indiana
sentence: The remaining miles are operated by 37 regional, local, and terminal railways.

name: indiana
sentence: The South Shore Line is one of the most important suburban rail networks in the country, extending from Chicago to South Bend.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is implementing a comprehensive railway plan prepared in 2002 by the Parsons Corporation.

name: indiana
sentence: Many recreational trails, such as the Monon Trail and Cardinal Greenway, were created from abandoned railways.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana ships more than 70 million tons of cargo annually by water, which ranks 14th among all U.S. states.

name: indiana
sentence: More than half of the Indiana border is water, which consists of 400 miles (640 km) of direct access to two major freight arteries: the Great Lakes and the St.

name: indiana
sentence: Lawrence Seaway (via Lake Michigan) and the inland waterway system (through the Ohio River).

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana harbours operate three major harbours, including Burns Harbor, Jeffersonville and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: In Evansville, three public port facilities and several private port facilities are served year-round by five major barge lines operating on the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: Evansville has been a U.S. customs port of entry for over 125 years.

name: indiana
sentence: For this reason, it is possible to have international shipments shipped to Evansville for customs purposes.

name: indiana
sentence: International freight can then clear customs at Evansville rather than a coastal port.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's constitution of 1816 was the first in the country to establish a publicly funded school system.

name: indiana
sentence: It also assigned a canton to a public university.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the plan proved far too idealistic for a pioneering society, as the tax money was not available to its organization.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1840s Caleb Mills insisted on the need for tax-funded schools, and in 1851 his councils were included in the new state constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1843, the Legislature decided that African-Americans could not attend public schools, leading to the founding of the Union Literary Institute and other schools for them, financed by donations or students themselves.

name: indiana
sentence: Although the growth of the public school system was hindered by legal entanglements, many public elementary schools were used in 1870.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Indiana children attend public schools, but nearly 10% attend private and parish schools.

name: indiana
sentence: About half of Indiana's students are enrolled in government-funded four-year schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's public schools have undergone a number of changes throughout Indiana's history.

name: indiana
sentence: The modern standards of public schools have been applied throughout the State.

name: indiana
sentence: The new standards were adopted in April 2014.

name: indiana
sentence: The overall objective of these new state standards is to ensure that Indiana students have the skills and requirements to enter college or labour force upon graduation from high school.

name: indiana
sentence: State standards can be found for almost all major subjects taught in Indiana's public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Mathematics, English and language arts, science and social studies are among the priority standards.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2017, the Indiana Ministry of Education reported that the overall rate of graduation was 87.19 per cent for exempt graduates and 80.10 per cent for graduates who are not eligible for graduation.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest educational institution is the University of Indiana, whose flagship campus was approved as the Indiana Seminary in 1820.

name: indiana
sentence: The State University of Indiana was established as the State Normal School in 1865.

name: indiana
sentence: The other three independent state universities are Vincennes University (Founded in 1801 by Indiana Territory), Ball State University (1918) and the University of Southern Indiana (1965 under the name of ISU – Evansville).

name: indiana
sentence: Many of the private colleges and universities in Indiana are affiliated with religious groups.

name: indiana
sentence: Notre-Dame University, Marian University and the University of Saint-François are popular Catholic schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Universities affiliated to Protestant denominations include Anderson University, Butler University, Huntington University, Manchester University, Indiana Wesleyan University, Taylor University, Franklin College, Hanover College, DePauw University, Earlham College, Valparaiso University, Indianapolis University and Evansville University.

name: indiana
sentence: The government's community college system, the Ivy Tech Community College of Indiana, serves nearly 200,000 students a year, making it the largest public post-secondary institution in the state and the largest system of accredited community colleges across the state.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2008, the University of Indiana system agreed to transfer most of its associated degrees (2 years) to the Ivy Tech Community College System.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has several universities ranked among the top in the 2013 US News & World Report rankings.

name: indiana
sentence: Notre Dame University is ranked among the top 20 with the University of Indiana Bloomington and Purdue being ranked among the top 100.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana University – Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) has recently been one of the top 200 US News & World Report.

name: indiana
sentence: Butler, Valparaiso and the University of Evansville are ranked among the top ten in the Midwest University regional rankings.

name: indiana
sentence: Purdue's engineering programs are ranked eighth in Canada.

name: indiana
sentence: In addition, Taylor University is ranked first at Midwest Rankings Regional College and the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is considered the best undergraduate engineering school (where a doctorate is not offered) for 15 consecutive years.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is a state in the Midwestern United States, bordered by Mississippi in the east and Missouri and Big Sioux in the west.

name: iowa
sentence: It is bordered by six states: Wisconsin in the northeast, Illinois in the east and southeast, Missouri in the south, Nebraska in the west, South Dakota in the northwest and Minnesota in the north.

name: iowa
sentence: In colonial times, the Iowa was part of French Louisiana and Spanish Louisiana; its state flag was inspired by the flag of France.

name: iowa
sentence: After Louisiana's purchase, people laid the foundation for an agriculture-based economy at the heart of the Corn Belt.

name: iowa
sentence: In the second half of the twentieth century, the agricultural economy of Iowa made the transition to a diversified economy of manufacturing, processing, financial services, information technology, biotechnology and green energy production.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the 26th largest of the total area and the 30th most populated of the 50 American states.

name: iowa
sentence: The capital of the state, the most populated city, and the largest metropolitan area entirely situated in the state is Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Part of the largest metropolitan area of Omaha, Nebraska, covers three counties in southwestern Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa has been listed as one of the safest American states to live in.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa derives its name from the people of Ioway, one of the many Amerindian nations whose territory included the future state at the time of European colonization.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa is bordered by Mississippi, to the east, Missouri and Big Sioux, to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: The northern boundary is a line along 43 degrees, 30 minutes north latitude.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern border is the Des Moines River and a line not quite straight along about 40 degrees 35 minutes north, as decided by the U.S. Supreme Court in Missouri v. Iowa (1849) after a confrontation between Missouri and Iowa known as the honey war.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the only state whose eastern and western borders are formed almost entirely by rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Carter Lake, Iowa, is the only town in the state west of Missouri.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has 99 counties but 100 county seats because Lee County has two.

name: iowa
sentence: The state capital, Des Moines, is located in Polk County.

name: iowa
sentence: Geology of the Iowa bedrock generally increases in western to eastern age.

name: iowa
sentence: In northwestern Iowa, cretaceous substrates may be 74 million years old; in eastern Iowa, Cambrian substrates are about 500 million years old.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is generally not flat.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa can be divided into eight forms of terrain based on glaciation, soils, topography and river drainage.

name: iowa
sentence: Loess Hills are located along the western border of the State, some of which are several hundred feet thick.

name: iowa
sentence: The northeast of Iowa along the upper Mississippi River is part of the Drift-free area, consisting of steep hills and valleys that appear almost mountainous.

name: iowa
sentence: Several natural lakes exist, particularly Spirit Lake, Okoboji Lake West, and Okoboji Lake East in northwestern Iowa (see Great Lakes of Iowa).

name: iowa
sentence: To the east is Clear Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Artificial lakes include Odessa Lake, Saylorville Lake, Red Rock Lake, Coralville Lake, MacBride Lake and Rathbun Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Prior to the European settlement, between 4 and 6 million acres of the state were covered by wetlands, and about 95% of these wetlands were drained.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa's natural vegetation consists of tall grass and savannah meadows in the highlands, dense forests and wetlands in floodplains and protected river valleys, and hen nest wetlands in the northern prairies.

name: iowa
sentence: Most of Iowa is used for agriculture; crops cover 60 per cent of the state, grasslands (mainly pasture and hay with grasslands and wetlands) cover 30 per cent, and forests 7 per cent, urban areas and water 1 per cent more each.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern part of Iowa is categorized as the ecoregion of transition between forests and central grasslands.

name: iowa
sentence: The northern, drier part of Iowa is classified as part of the Central High Plains.

name: iowa
sentence: There is a shortage of natural areas in Iowa; less than 1% of the high-grass prairies that once covered most of Iowa remain intact; only about 5% of the wetlands in the state pothole remain, and most of the original forest has been lost.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2005, Iowa was ranked 49th in the U.S. in public land.

name: iowa
sentence: Threatened or endangered animals in Iowa include the lower inner tern, the plover, the Indiana bat, the pallided sturgeon, the Pleistocene snail of Iowa, the pearl mussel of the Higgins eye and the Topeka sturgeon.

name: iowa
sentence: Threatened or endangered plants include western prairie fringe orchids, eastern prairie fringe orchids, Mead's milkweed, prairie clover and northern wild monks.

name: iowa
sentence: The explosion in the number of high-density livestock facilities in Iowa has led to an increase in water contamination in rural areas and a decline in air quality.

name: iowa
sentence: Other factors that have a negative impact on the Iowa environment include the intensive use of former coal-fired power plants, fertilizers and runoff of pesticides from agricultural production, and the reduction of the Jordanian aquifer.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa has a humid continental climate throughout the state (Köppen climate classification Dfa) with extremes of heat and cold.

name: iowa
sentence: The average annual temperature at Des Moines is 50°F (10°C); for some locations in the north, such as Mason City, the figure is approximately 45°F (7°C), while Keokuk, on the Mississippi River, has an average of 52°F (11°C).

name: iowa
sentence: Snowfall is common, with Des Moines with about 26 days of snowfall per year, and other places, such as Shenandoah with about 11 days of snowfall in a year.

name: iowa
sentence: Spring inaugurates the beginning of the violent season.

name: iowa
sentence: On average, Iowa produces about 50 days of stormy activity per year.

name: iowa
sentence: The annual average of the 30-year Tornadoes in Iowa is 47.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2008, 12 people were killed by tornadoes in Iowa, making it the most deadly year since 1968 and the second largest tornado in a year with 105, the total in 2001.

name: iowa
sentence: Summers of Iowa are known for heat and humidity, sometimes with diurnal temperatures close to 90 °F (32 °C) and sometimes above 100 °F (38 °C).

name: iowa
sentence: Middle winters in the state are known to fall well below freezing, even below -18°F (−28°C).

name: iowa
sentence: The warmest temperature of Iowa at 118 °F (48 °C) was recorded at Keokuk on 20 July 1934 during a nationwide heat wave; the lowest temperature of Iowa at -47 °F (−44 °C) was recorded at Washta on 12 January 1912.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a relatively smooth gradient of variable precipitation throughout the state, with regions in the southeast receiving on average more than 38 inches (97 cm) of rain per year and the northwest receiving less than 28 inches (71 cm).

name: iowa
sentence: The precipitation trend across the Iowa is seasonal, with more rain falling in the summer months.

name: iowa
sentence: Nearly state-wide, the driest month is January or February, and the wettest month is June, due to frequent showers and thunderstorms, some of which produce hail, bad winds and/or tornadoes.

name: iowa
sentence: In Des Moines, about in the center of the state, more than two-thirds of the 34.72-inch (88.2 cm) rain falls from April to September, and about half of the average annual rainfall falls from May to August, reaching a peak in June.

name: iowa
sentence: When the Amerindians arrived in what is now Iowa more than 13,000 years ago, they were hunters and gatherers living in a glacial landscape of the Pleistocene.

name: iowa
sentence: At the time European explorers and traders visited Iowa, American Indians were largely farmers established with complex economic, social and political systems.

name: iowa
sentence: This transformation has gradually taken place.

name: iowa
sentence: During the archaic period (10,500 to 2,800 years), American Indians adapted to local environments and ecosystems, slowly becoming more sedentary as populations increased.

name: iowa
sentence: More than 3,000 years ago, at the end of the archaic period, Iowa Native Americans began using domesticated plants.

name: iowa
sentence: In the following period, there was increased dependence on agriculture and social complexity, with increased use of mounds, ceramics and specialized subsistence.

name: iowa
sentence: During the late prehistoric period (beginning around 900 A.D.) the increased use of corn and social changes led to flourishing and nuclinated social institutions.

name: iowa
sentence: The arrival of European goods and diseases in the protohistoric period led to dramatic demographic changes and economic and social upheavals, with the arrival of new tribes and first European explorers and traders.

name: iowa
sentence: At the beginning of the European exploration, many Indian tribes lived in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: The tribes that were probably descendants of prehistoric Oneota include Dakota, Ho-Chunk, Ioway, and Otoe.

name: iowa
sentence: The tribes that arrived in Iowa at the end of prehistoric or protohistoric periods include the Illinik, Meskwaki, Omaha and Sauk.

name: iowa
sentence: The first European explorers known to document Iowa were Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet who travelled the Mississippi in 1673 to document several indigenous villages on the Iowa side.

name: iowa
sentence: The region of Iowa was claimed for France and remained a French territory until 1763.

name: iowa
sentence: The French, before their imminent defeat in the French and Indian war, transferred ownership to their ally, Spain.

name: iowa
sentence: Spain has exercised very loose control over the Iowa region, granting commercial licences to French and British traders, who have established trading posts along the Mississippi and Des Moines rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa was part of a territory known as Louisiana or Louisiana, and European traders were interested in lead and fur obtained by the natives.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki effectively controlled the Mississippi trade in the late 18th and early 19th centuries.

name: iowa
sentence: Among the first Mississippi merchants were Julien Dubuque, Robert de la Salle and Paul Marin.

name: iowa
sentence: Along the Missouri River, at least five French and English commercial houses were built before 1808.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1800, Napoleon Bonaparte took control of Louisiana in Spain under a treaty.

name: iowa
sentence: After the purchase of Louisiana in 1803, Congress divided the purchase of Louisiana into two parts, the territory of Orléans and the district of Louisiana, the present Iowa falling into the latter.

name: iowa
sentence: Indiana was established in 1800 to exercise jurisdiction over that part of the district.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of the Iowa was mapped by Zebulon Pike in 1805, but only when Fort Madison was built in 1808 did the United States establish tenuous military control over the area.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was built to control the trade and establish American domination over the Upper Mississippi, but it was misconceived and hostile by the Sauk and Fox, many of whom were allies with the British, who had not abandoned the claims to the territory.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was defeated by the British-backed Aboriginal people in 1813 during the War of 1812, and Fort Shelby, on the Dog Prairie in Wisconsin, also fell into British hands.

name: iowa
sentence: Black Hawk participated in the siege of Fort Madison.

name: iowa
sentence: Another small military outpost was established along the Mississippi River in the present Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: This poorly located stockade was also attacked by hundreds of Aboriginal people in 1813, but was successfully defended and abandoned later until the settlers returned to the area in the mid-1830s.

name: iowa
sentence: After the war, the United States restored control of the area through the construction of Fort Armstrong, Fort Snelling in Minnesota, and Fort Atkinson in Nebraska.

name: iowa
sentence: The United States encouraged settlement on the east side of Mississippi and the movement of Indians westward.

name: iowa
sentence: A disputed treaty of 1804 between Quashquame and William Henry Harrison, which delivered much of Illinois to the United States, enraged many Sauk and led to the Black Hawk War in 1832.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki sold their land in the Mississippi Valley in 1832 as part of Black Hawk's purchase and sold their remaining land in Iowa in 1842, most of which settled in a reserve in Kansas.

name: iowa
sentence: Many Meskwaki then returned to Iowa and settled near Tama, Iowa; the Meskwaki settlement remains to this day.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1856, the Iowa Legislature passed an unprecedented law that allowed Meskawki to buy land.

name: iowa
sentence: However, contrary to the unprecedented act of the Iowa Legislature, the United States federal government, through the use of treaties, forced the Ho-Chunk of Iowa in 1848 and the Dakota of Iowa in 1858.

name: iowa
sentence: The Western Iowa around the Council's modern Bluffs was used as an Indian reserve for the members of the Council of the Three Fires.

name: iowa
sentence: The first American settlers officially moved to Iowa in June 1833.

name: iowa
sentence: Mainly, they were families from Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, Indiana, Kentucky, and Virginia who settled along the western shores of Mississippi and founded the modern cities of Dubuque and Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: On 4 July 1838, the U.S. Congress created the territory of Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: President Martin Van Buren appointed Robert Lucas Governor of the Territory, who at the time had 22 counties and a population of 23,242.

name: iowa
sentence: Almost immediately after obtaining territorial status, there was a call for state status.

name: iowa
sentence: On December 28, 1846, Iowa became the 29th State of the Union when President James K. Polk signed the Iowa Admission Bill.

name: iowa
sentence: Once admitted to the Union, the State's border problems resolved, and most of its land purchased from Aboriginal people, Iowa gave its direction to development and organized campaigns for settlers and investors, boasting the rich agricultural lands of the young border state, good citizens, free and open society, and good government.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a long tradition of state and county fairs.

name: iowa
sentence: The first and second Iowa State Fairs were held in the more developed eastern part of Fairfield State.

name: iowa
sentence: The first fair was held from October 25 to 27, 1854, at a cost of approximately $323.

name: iowa
sentence: Subsequently, the fair moved to places closer to the centre of the state and in 1886 found a permanent house in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Since then, the State Fair has been held every year, with a few exceptions: in 1898 because of the war between Spain and America and the World Fair held in Omaha, Nebraska, nearby; from 1942 to 1945 because of the Second World War, because the fairs were used as a supply depot for the army; and in 2020 because of the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa supported the Union during the civil war, voting strongly for Abraham Lincoln, although there was an anti-war "Copperhead" movement in the state, caused in part by a fall in crop prices caused by the war.

name: iowa
sentence: There was no battle in the state, although the Battle of Athens, the Missouri, 1861, was fought just in front of the Croton Moines River, the Iowa, and the shots of the battle landed in the Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa sent important supplies to the armies and eastern cities.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of Iowa's support of the Union can be attributed to Samuel J. Kirkwood, his first war governor.

name: iowa
sentence: Of a total of 675,000 inhabitants, approximately 116,000 were subjected to military functions.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa contributed proportionately more men to the military service of the civil war than any other state, north or south, by sending more than 75,000 volunteers to the armed forces, more than a sixth of whom were killed before the Confederates went to Appomattox.

name: iowa
sentence: Most of them fought in the large countryside in the Mississippi Valley and in the South.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa troops fought at Wilson's Creek in Missouri, Pea Ridge in Arkansas, Forts Henry and Donelson, Shiloh, Chattanooga, Chickamauga, Missionary Ridge and Rossville Gap, as well as Vicksburg, Iuka and Corinth.

name: iowa
sentence: They served with the Potomac Army in Virginia and fought under Union General Philip Sheridan in the Shenandoah Valley.

name: iowa
sentence: Several died and were buried in Andersonville.

name: iowa
sentence: They marched on General Nathaniel Banks' reckless expedition to the Red River.

name: iowa
sentence: Twenty-seven Iowans received the Medal of Honour, the highest military decoration awarded by the U.S. government, which was first awarded during the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: There were several Brigadier Generals and four principal Generals in Iowa, namely Grenville Mellen Dodge, Samuel R. Curtis, Francis J. Herron and Frederick Steele, and many of his generals were prominent in the aftermath of the war.

name: iowa
sentence: After the civil war, the Iowa population continued to grow dramatically, from 674,913 in 1860 to 1,624,615 in 1880.

name: iowa
sentence: The U.S. civil war briefly brought higher profits.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1917, the United States entered the First World War and farmers and all Iowans had an economy in times of war.

name: iowa
sentence: For farmers, the change was important.

name: iowa
sentence: Since the beginning of the war in 1914, the Iowa peasants have enjoyed economic prosperity, which lasted until the end of the war.

name: iowa
sentence: In the economic sector, Iowa has also undergone significant changes.

name: iowa
sentence: Since the first industries developed in the 1830s, mainly for the processing of materials grown in the region, Iowa has seen a gradual increase in the number of enterprises and manufacturing operations.

name: iowa
sentence: The transition from an agricultural economy to a mixed economy has been slow.

name: iowa
sentence: The Great Depression and the Second World War accelerated the shift from smallholder farming to larger farms, and began a trend towards urbanization.

name: iowa
sentence: The post-World War II period was marked by a particular increase in manufacturing operations.

name: iowa
sentence: The agricultural crisis of the 1980s caused a major recession in Iowa, causing the poverty that has not been observed since the depression.

name: iowa
sentence: The crisis caused a major demographic decline, which lasted a decade.

name: iowa
sentence: After falling apart in the 1980s, the Iowa economy began to depend less and less on agriculture.

name: iowa
sentence: At the beginning of the 21st century, it was characterized by a combination of manufacturing services, biotechnology, finance and insurance, and government services.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa population has grown at a faster rate than the United States as a whole, and Iowa now has a predominantly urban population.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Economic Development Directorate, established in 2011, replaced the Iowa Economic Development Department and its annual reports are a source of economic information.

name: iowa
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the Iowa population was 3,155,070 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 3.57 per cent over the 2010 Census.

name: iowa
sentence: Of the Iowa residents, 70.8 per cent were born in Iowa, 23.6 per cent were born in another U.S. state, 0.6 per cent were born in Puerto Rico, the U.S. islands, or were born abroad to U.S. parents, and 5 per cent were born abroad.

name: iowa
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 29,386 persons, while migration within the country resulted in a net loss of 41,140 persons.

name: iowa
sentence: 6.5% of the Iowa population were under five years of age, 22.6% were under 18 years of age, and 14.7% were 65 years of age or older.

name: iowa
sentence: Men made up approximately 49.6 per cent of the population.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa banned the Sanctuary Cities.

name: iowa
sentence: The population density of the State is 52.7 people per square mile.

name: iowa
sentence: As of the 2010 census, the Iowa population centre is located in Marshall County, near Melbourne.

name: iowa
sentence: At the 2010 census, the Iowa population was 3,046,355.

name: iowa
sentence: The gender composition of the State was 49.5 per cent male and 50.5 per cent female.

name: iowa
sentence: 23.9% of the population were under 18 years of age.

name: iowa
sentence: The table below shows the racial composition of the Iowa population in 2018.

name: iowa
sentence: According to the 2016 U.S. Community Survey, 5.6% of the Iowa population were of Hispanic or Latin origin (of any race): Mexican (4.3%), Puerto Rican (0.2%), Cuban (0.1%) and other Hispanic or Latin origin (1.0%).

name: iowa
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups were German (35.1%), Irish (13.5%), English (8.2%), American (5.8%) and Norwegian (5.0%).

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa population is more urban than rural, with 61 per cent living in urban areas in 2000, a trend that began in the early twentieth century.

name: iowa
sentence: Urban Iowa counties grew by 8.5 per cent between 2000 and 2008, while rural counties declined by 4.2 per cent.

name: iowa

sentence: In Iowa, the term "political party" refers to political organizations that obtained at least two per cent of the votes cast for the president or governor in the "last general election".

sentence: The Iowa recognizes three political parties – the Republican Party, the Democratic Party and the libertarian Party.

sentence: The State receives considerable attention every four years because the Iowa caucus, which brings together voters to select delegates to state conventions, is the country's first presidential caucus.

name: iowa
sentence: In the 19th century, Iowa was one of the first states to enact prohibitions against racial discrimination, particularly in education, but was slow to achieve full integration in the 20th century.

name: iowa
sentence: In the first decision of the Iowa Supreme Court — in Re the Matter of Ralph, rendered in July 1839 — the Court rejected slavery in a decision that found a slave named free Ralph when he walked on the Iowa soil, 26 years before the end of the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: The state removed racial barriers to marriage in 1851, more than 100 years before the U.S. Supreme Court prohibited deceit laws at the national level.

name: iowa
sentence: The Supreme Court of Iowa rendered a decision in Clark v. The Board of Directors in 1868, ruling that "separate but equal" schools of a racial nature had no place in Iowa, 85 years before Brown v. Board of Education.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1875, a number of other court decisions effectively put an end to segregation in Iowa schools.

name: iowa
sentence: Social and housing discrimination continued against Blacks in state universities until the 1950s.

name: iowa
sentence: The Court heard Coger v. The North Western Union Packet Co. in 1873, ruling against racial discrimination in public institutions 91 years before the Supreme Court of the United States reached the same decision.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1884, the Iowa Civil Rights Act apparently prohibited business discrimination: "Everyone in that State has the right to the full and equal enjoyment of accommodation, benefits, facilities and privileges of inns, restaurants, cellars, dining houses, dining counters and all other places where refreshments are served, public transportation, hairdressing salons, baths, theatres and all other places of fun".

name: iowa
sentence: However, the courts have chosen to strictly apply this law, allowing for the continuation of de facto discrimination.

name: iowa
sentence: Racial discrimination in public enterprises was found illegal only in 1949, when the court ruled in the State of Iowa v. Katz that companies should serve their customers regardless of their race; the case began when Edna Griffin was denied service at a pharmacy in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: All racial civil rights were codified under the Iowa Civil Rights Act 1965.

name: iowa
sentence: Like racial equality, Iowa was the vanguard of women's rights in the mid-19th century, but did not allow women to vote until the 19th amendment to the United States Constitution was ratified in 1920, with Iowa being one of the ratification votes.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1847, Iowa University became the first public university in the United States to admit men and women on an equal footing.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1869, Iowa became the first State of the Union to admit women to the practice of law, the Court ruling that women cannot be denied the right to practice law in Iowa and to admit Arabella A. Mansfield to the practice of law.

name: iowa
sentence: Several attempts to grant full voting rights to women in Iowa were defeated between 1870 and 1919.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1894, women were granted "partial suffrage", allowing them to vote on matters, but not for candidates.

name: iowa
sentence: It is only upon ratification of the nineteenth amendment that women have the right to vote in full in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Although Iowa supported the federal amendment to equal rights, in 1980 and 1992, Iowa voters rejected an amendment to the State Constitution on equal rights.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa added the word "women" to the Constitution of Iowa in 1998.

name: iowa
sentence: After the amendment, it reads as follows: "All men and women are, by nature, free and equal, and have certain inalienable rights, including those to enjoy and defend life and liberty, to acquire, possess and protect property, and to seek and obtain security and happiness."

name: kansas

sentence: Thus, the region was a home of violence and chaos in its early days as these forces clashed, and was known as the Kansas Blood.

sentence: In 2015, Kansas was one of the most productive agricultural states, producing high yields of wheat, corn, sorghum and soybeans.

sentence: The land rises gradually from east to west, with elevations ranging from 684 ft (208 m) along the Verdigris River at Coffeyville, Montgomery County, to 4,039 ft (1,231 m) at Sunflower Mountain, 0.5 miles (0.80 km) from Colorado Border, Wallace County.

name: kansas
sentence: It is a common misconception that Kansas is the flattest state in the nation - in 2003, a language study in Cheek famously declared the state "flatter than a pancake".

sentence: According to the climate classification of Köppen, the climate of Kansas can be characterized in three types: it has a continental, semi-arid and subtropical wet steppe.

name: kansas
sentence: Two thirds of the state (especially the northeast) has a humid continental climate, with cold winters and warm, often humid summers.

name: kansas
sentence: Most precipitation falls both in summer and spring.

name: kansas
sentence: The western third of the state — from the U.S. Highway 83 corridor westward — has a semi-arid steppe climate.

name: kansas
sentence: Summers are hot, often very hot, and usually less humid.

name: kansas
sentence: Winters are very variable between hot and very cold.

name: kansas
sentence: The western region receives an average of approximately 16 inches (410 millimetres) of precipitation per year.

name: kansas
sentence: Chinook winds in winter can heat western Kansas up to 80 degrees Fahrenheit (27 degrees Celsius).

name: kansas
sentence: The south-central and south-eastern portions of the state, including the Wichita region, have a humid subtropical climate with warm and humid summers, milder winters and more precipitation than elsewhere in Kansas.

name: kansas
sentence: Some of the characteristics of the three climates are found in most of the state, with droughts and changing weather conditions between dry and wet not uncommon, and both warm and cold spells in winter.

sentence: Roads 83 and 81, as well as the southwestern part of the state along and south of the United States 50, reach 90°F (32°C) or above most days of June, July and August.

sentence: During the summer, low night temperatures in the north-eastern part of the State, particularly in the larger cities mentioned above, hardly fall below 80 °F (27 °C).

Maine is the only American state whose name has only one syllable.

sentence: Maine has a humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dfb), with warm and sometimes humid summers, and long, cold and very snowy winters.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts, officially known as Commonwealth of Massachusetts, is the most populous state in New England in the northeastern United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It borders the Atlantic Ocean to the east, the states of Connecticut and Rhode Island to the south, New Hampshire and Vermont to the north and New York to the west.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The capital of Massachusetts is Boston, the most populated city in New England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It is home to the Greater Boston metropolitan area, an area that affects American history, academia and industry.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Originally dependent on agriculture, fisheries and commerce, Massachusetts was transformed into a manufacturing centre during the Industrial Revolution.

name: massachusetts
sentence: During the 20th century, Massachusetts' economy shifted from manufacturing to services.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Modern Massachusetts is a world leader in biotechnology, engineering, higher education, finance and maritime trade.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Plymouth was the site of the second colony in New England after Popham Colony in 1607 in what is now Maine.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Plymouth was founded in 1620 by pilgrims, passengers of the Mayflower.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1692 the city of Salem and the surrounding area experienced one of the most famous cases of mass hysteria in America, the trials of the witches of Salem.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1777, General Henry Knox founded the Springfield Armory, which, during the Industrial Revolution, catalysed many important technological advances, including interchangeable parts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1786 Shays' rebellion, a populist revolt led by disused American Revolutionary War veterans, influenced the United States Constitutional Convention.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the 18th century, the first great Protestant revival, which swept Britain and the Thirteen colonies, came from the pulpit of Northampton preacher Jonathan Edwards.

name: massachusetts
sentence: At the end of the 18th century Boston became known as "Cradle of Liberty" for its agitation that later led to the American Revolution.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The whole Commonwealth of Massachusetts has played an important scientific, commercial and cultural role in the history of the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Before the American Civil War, Massachusetts was the centre of abolitionist, temperant, and transcendentalist movements.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the late 19th century, basketball and volleyball were invented in the cities of Springfield and Holyoke, respectively, in western Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2004, Massachusetts became the first state in the United States to legally recognize same-sex marriage as a result of the Massachusetts Supreme Court decision in Goodridge v. Department of Public Health.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many prominent American political dynasties came from the state, including the Adams and Kennedy families.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Harvard University in Cambridge is the oldest institution of higher education in the United States, with the greatest funding from any university, and Harvard Law School has formed a contemporary majority of the judges of the Supreme Court of the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Kendall Square in Cambridge has been called "the most innovative square kilometre on the planet", in reference to the high concentration of entrepreneurial start-ups and the quality of innovation that have emerged in the vicinity of the square since 2010.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Harvard and MIT, also in Cambridge, were ranked among the world's top academic institutions.

sentence: Students from Massachusetts Public School are among the highest levels of academic performance in the world.

sentence: The state has been ranked as one of the best states in the U.S. for citizens to live, as well as one of the most expensive.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts Bay colony was named after the native population, Massachusett, whose name is probably derived from a word Wôpanâak muswachasut, segmented into mus(ây) "big" + wach8 "mountain" + -s "diminutive" + -ut "locative" (the '8" in these words refers to sound 'oo' according to Wôpanâak's spelling map).

name: massachusetts
sentence: It has been translated as "near the great hill", "by the blue hills", "at the small large hill", or "at the range of the hills", referring to the blue hills, or in particular the Great Blue Hill, which is located at the boundary of Milton and Canton.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On the other hand, Massachusett was represented as Moswetuset — by the name of the Moswetuset Hummock (which means "stick in the shape of an arrow") in Quincy, where the commander of the colony of Plymouth Myles Standish (a committed English officer) and Squanto (a member of the now extinct Patuxet band of the Wampanoag peoples) met Chief Chickatawbut in 1621.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The official name of the state is "Commonwealth of Massachusetts".

sentence: Although the designation "Commonwealth" is part of the official name of the State, it has no practical implications.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has the same position and power within the United States as other states.

name: massachusetts
sentence: John Adams in 1779 may have chosen the word for the second draft of what became the Constitution of Massachusetts of 1780 because contrary to the word "state", "commonwealth" at the time had the connotation of a republic, unlike the monarchy the former American colonies fought against.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Originally, Massachusetts was inhabited by tribes of the Algonquian family such as Wampanoag, Narragansett, Nipmuc, Pocomtuc, Mahican, and Massachusett.

name: massachusetts
sentence: While crops such as squash and corn supplemented their diet, these tribes generally depended on hunting, gathering and fishing for most of their food.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The villages consisted of lodges called wigwams and long houses, and the tribes were ruled by elders, male or female, known as Sachems.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the early 1600s, after contact with Europeans, many indigenous peoples in the north-east of what is now the United States were killed by epidemics of virgin land such as smallpox, measles, influenza and possibly leptospirosis.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Between 1617 and 1619, what was possibly smallpox killed about 90% of the Amerindians of Massachusetts Bay.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The first English settlers of Massachusetts, the pilgrims, arrived on the Mayflower in Plymouth in 1620, and developed friendly relations with the indigenous Wampanoag people.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This was the second successful permanent English colony in the part of North America that later became the United States, after the Jamestown colony.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The event is known as the "First Thanksgiving" was celebrated by pilgrims after their first harvest in the New World, which lasted three days.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The pilgrims were soon followed by other Puritans, who established the Massachusetts Bay settlement in Boston in 1630.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Puritans, who believed that the Church of England needed to be purified and harassed by English authority because of their beliefs, came to Massachusetts to establish an ideal religious society.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Unlike the Plymouth settlement, the Bay colony was founded in 1629 under a royal charter.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Religious dissent and expansionism led to the creation of several new colonies soon after Plymouth and Massachusetts Bay elsewhere in New England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts Bay banished dissidents like Anne Hutchinson and Roger Williams because of religious and political disagreements.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1636 Williams founded the Rhode Island colony and Hutchinson joined it several years later.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Religious intolerance is continuing.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Among those who opposed it later in the century were the English preachers Alice and Thomas Curwen, who were publicly whipped and imprisoned in Boston in 1676.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1641, Massachusetts grew considerably inland, acquiring the colony of the Connecticut River Valley of Springfield, which had recently challenged the Connecticut colony and had lost its original administrators.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This established the southern border of Massachusetts in the west, although survey problems gave rise to disputed territories until 1803–04.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Money was another problem in the settlements.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1652 the Massachusetts Legislature authorized John Hull to produce coins (mintmaster).

sentence: Climate change in Massachusetts will affect urban and rural areas, including forestry, fisheries, agriculture and coastal development.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The northeast is expected to warm faster than the global average; by 2035, the northeast is expected to be warmer on average at more than 3.6°F (2°C) than at pre-industrial times.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In August 2016, EPA reported that Massachusetts warmed up by more than two degrees Fahrenheit or 1.1 degrees Celsius.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This is almost twice the average for the contiguous United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The change in temperature also results in a change in precipitation patterns and an increase in precipitation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To this end, average precipitation in the northeastern United States increased by 10 per cent from 1895 to 2011, and the number of high precipitation events increased by 70 per cent over this period.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These increased precipitation patterns are concentrated in winter and spring.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Increased temperatures coupled with increased precipitation will result in earlier snowmelts and drier soils during the summer months.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Climate change in Massachusetts will bring about a significant change in the environment and built ecosystems.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In Boston alone, the cost of climate change storms will result in damages of $5 to $100 billion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These costs are attributable to the expected damage to coastal homes, the destruction of roads, and the current exposure to utilities infrastructure.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Warmer temperatures will also disrupt the migration of birds and the flowering of flora.

sentence: In addition, rising temperatures will increase the number of cases of Lyme disease reported in the state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On April 22, 2020, Massachusetts Secretary of Energy and Environmental Affairs, Kathleen A. Theoharides, released a national emission limit determination for 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To ensure that the Commonwealth does not warm up more than 1.5°C of levels before industrialization, the state will strive to achieve zero net emissions and an overall reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 85 per cent by 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The State of Massachusetts has developed a plethora of incentives to encourage the implementation of renewable energy and efficient domestic appliances and installations.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mass Save was created in collaboration with the state by Berkshire Gas, Blackstone Gas Company, Cape Light Compact, Eversource, Liberty Utilities, National Grid and Unitil to provide homeowners and tenants with incentives to renovate their homes with efficient HVAC equipment and other household appliances.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For example, up to $100 can be obtained for upgrades to an ENERGY STAR certified smart or programmable thermostat.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other appliances such as water heaters, air conditioners, washers and dryers, as well as heat pumps, are eligible for additional rebates.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The concept of Mass Save was created in 2008 by the adoption of the Green Communities Act 2008 during Deval Patrick's term of office.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The main objective of the Green Communities Act was to reduce fossil fuel consumption in the State and to encourage the adoption of new and more efficient technologies.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Among other things, one of the results of this law was the obligation for public service program administrators to invest in energy saving, as opposed to the purchase and production of additional energy where economically possible.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In Massachusetts, eleven program administrators, including NSTAR, National Grid, Western Massachusetts Electric, Cape Light Compact, Till and Berkshire Gas, jointly hold the program rights, in collaboration with the Energy Resources Department of AM (DOER) and the Energy Efficiency Advisory Board (EEAC).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mass Save also conducts home energy assessments free of charge so that homeowners, tenants and small business owners can learn about improving home energy efficiency and find opportunities to save money and energy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: During the home evaluation, Mass Save provides ENERGY STAR certified LED bulbs, power bands, low-flow shower heads, faucet aerators and efficient thermostats for free.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, air leaks will be detected in the house or building and corrected, and recommendations will be made for additional insulation to reduce the loss of heated or cooled air.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Discounts of 75% or more are available on these insulation upgrades.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Due to the COVID-19, Mass Save is currently conducting remote assessments.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residents can program a remote assessment using the program's website or telephone line.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The State Income Service encourages the installation of solar panels.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition to the federal residential renewable energy credit, residents of Massachusetts may be eligible for a tax credit of up to 15 percent of the project.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Once installed, tables are eligible for net measurement.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Some municipalities will offer up to $1.20 per watt, up to 50% of the system cost on photovoltaic networks of 25 kW or less.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts Department of Energy also provides low interest rate fixed-rate financing with loan support to low-income residents.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Currently, this programme is expected to end on 31 December 2020.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As part of the Massachusetts Ministry of Energy's efforts to encourage the use of renewable energy, the MOR-EV or Massachusetts Offers Debates for Electric Vehicles initiative was established.

name: massachusetts
sentence: With this incentive, residents may be entitled to a government incentive of up to $2,500 for the purchase or rental of an electric vehicle, or $1,500 for the purchase or rental of a plug-in hybrid vehicle.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This rebate is in addition to the U.S. Department of Energy's tax credits for the purchase of electric and rechargeable hybrid vehicles.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For income-eligible residents, Mass Save has partnered with Massachusetts Community Action Program organizations and the Low-Income Energy Affordability Network (LEAN) to provide housing improvement assistance to residents, which will result in more efficient use of energy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residents may be entitled to a replacement of their heating system, insulation system, appliances and thermostats if they meet the income requirements set out on the Mass Save website.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For residents of more than 5 family residential buildings, there are additional benefits limited to available income through the LEAN.

name: massachusetts
sentence: If at least 50% of building residents are eligible for low income, energy efficiency improvements, such as those available through Mass Save, are available.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residential structures managed by non-profit organizations, for gainful activities or housing authorities can benefit from these programs.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts was founded and established by the British Puritans in 1620 and shortly thereafter by other groups of separatists/dissidents, non-conformists and independents of 17th-century England.

sentence: Today, the majority of the people in Massachusetts remain Christians.

sentence: Some have been disaffiliated with Roman Catholics and other Christian groups as a result of modern secularization.

name: michigan
sentence: There are two types of township in Michigan: the Township of General Law and the Township of Charter.

name: michigan
sentence: The charter canton status was created by the Legislature in 1947 and grants additional powers and continuous administration in order to offer greater protection against annexation by a city.

name: michigan
sentence: As of April 2001, there were 127 charter townships in Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: In general, charter cantons have much of the same powers as a city, but without the same level of obligations.

name: michigan
sentence: For example, a charter canton may have its own fire service, water and sewer service, police service, etc. – just like a city – but it is not necessary to have these things, while cities have to provide these services.

name: michigan
sentence: Charter Townships may choose to use county-wide services, such as the deputies of the county sheriff's office instead of a home-based prescription force.

sentence: Michigan consists of two peninsulas separated by the Strait of Mackinac.

sentence: The 45th parallel north crosses the state, marked by road signs and the Polar Ecuador trail, along a line comprising Mission Point Light near Traverse City, the cities of Gaylord and Alpena in the Lower Peninsula and Menominee in the Upper Peninsula.

name: michigan
sentence: With the exception of two small areas drained by the Mississippi River by the Wisconsin River on the upper peninsula and the Kankakee-Illinois River on the lower peninsula, Michigan is drained by the Great Lakes and St. Lawrence River watershed and is the only state where most of its lands are drained.

name: michigan

name: michigan
sentence: There are 11,037 inland lakes, representing a total of 1,305 square miles (3,380 km2) of inland waters, in addition to 38,575 square miles (99910 km2) of Great Lakes waters.

name: michigan
sentence: The largest section of the North Country National Scenography Trail crosses Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: With 78 state parks, 19 state recreation areas and six state forests, Michigan has the largest state park and the largest state forest network in any state.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has a continental climate, even though there are two distinct regions.

name: michigan
sentence: The southern and central parts of the Lower Peninsula (south of Saginaw Bay and the Grand Rapids area southward) have a warmer climate (Köppen Dfa climate classification) with warm summers and cold winters.

name: michigan
sentence: The northern part of the Lower Peninsula and the entire Upper Peninsula has a more severe climate (Köppen Dfb), with hot summers, but shorter and longer, cold to very cold winters.

name: michigan
sentence: Some of the average state temperatures are below freezing from December to February and until early March in distant northern areas.

name: michigan
sentence: During the winter until mid-February, the state is often subjected to heavy lake-effect snowfalls.

name: michigan
sentence: The average condition ranges from 30 to 40 inches (76 to 102 cm) of precipitation per year; however, some areas of the lower north and upper peninsula average about 160 inches (4,100 mm) of snowfall per year.

name: michigan
sentence: The highest temperature recorded in Michigan was 112°F (44°C) at Mio on 13 July 1936 and the coldest temperature recorded was −51°F (−46°C) at Vanderbilt on 9 February 1934.

name: michigan
sentence: The state has an average of 30 days of stormy activity per year.

name: michigan
sentence: These can be severe, especially in the southern part of the state.

name: michigan
sentence: The state has an average of 17 tornadoes per year, which are more common in the extreme south of the state.

name: michigan
sentence: The parts of the southern border have been almost as vulnerable historically as the states to the west and the Aisle of Tornado.

name: michigan
sentence: For this reason, many communities in the very south of the state have tornado sirens to warn residents to approach tornadoes.

name: michigan
sentence: Further north, in central Michigan, northern Michigan, and the upper peninsula, tornadoes are rare.

name: michigan
sentence: The state's geological formation varies considerably, with the Michigan Basin being the largest formation.

name: michigan

name: michigan

name: michigan
sentence: The central part of the Lower Peninsula contains coal measurements and rocks of the Pennsylvanian period.

name: michigan
sentence: Devonian and subcarboniferous deposits are dispersed throughout the state.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan rarely experiences earthquakes, so far mostly smaller, that do not cause significant damage.

sentence: Montana is a state in the northwestern part of the United States.

sentence: It is bordered by Idaho to the west; North Dakota and South Dakota to the east; Wyoming to the south; and the Canadian provinces of Alberta, British Columbia and Saskatchewan to the north.

name: montana
sentence: It is the fourth largest state per region, the eighth least populated and the third least dense.

sentence: Montana has no official nickname, but several unofficial names, including "Big Sky Country", "The Treasure State", "Land of the Shining Mountains", and "The Last Best Place".

sentence: The economy is based primarily on agriculture, including livestock and cereals.

sentence: The name Montana comes from the Spanish word montaña, which in turn comes from the Latin word montanea, meaning "mountain" or more widely "mountainous country".

sentence: The name Montana was added in 1863 to a bill of the United States House Committee on Territories (then chaired by James Ashley of Ohio) for the territory that was to become the territory of Idaho.

name: montana
sentence: The name was changed by representatives Henry Wilson (Massachusetts) and Benjamin F. Harding (Oregon), who complained Montana had "no meaning".

sentence: When Ashley introduced a bill to establish a temporary government in 1864 for a new territory to be dug out of Idaho, he again chose the territory of Montana.

name: montana
sentence: This time, Rep. Samuel Cox, also from Ohio, opposed the name.

name: montana
sentence: Cox complained that the name was a bad name because most of the territory was not mountainous and an Amerindian name would be more appropriate than a Spanish name.

name: montana
sentence: Other names such as Shoshone were suggested, but the Territorial Committee decided that they could appoint it as they wished, so that the original name of Montana was adopted.

sentence: Nevada (Spanish: "Nevada") is a state in the western United States of America.

sentence: Carson City is the capital city of Nevada.

sentence: Nevada is officially known as the "state of money" because of the importance of money for its history and economy.

sentence: It is also known as the "Battle-born State" because it reached state status during the civil war (the words "born of the Battle" also appear on the State flag), as "born state of Wisdom", for the native plant of the same name, and as "born state of Wisdom".

name: nevada
sentence: The name means "snow cover" in Spanish, referring to the small overlap of Nevada with the mountain range of Sierra Nevada; however, the rest of Nevada is largely deserted and semi-arid, much of it in the Great Basin.

sentence: The United States annexed the region in 1848 after its victory in the war between Mexico and the United States, and it was incorporated into Utah territory in 1850.

sentence: Nevada became the 36th state on 31 October 1864, the second of the two states to join the Union during the civil war (the first being West Virginia).

sentence: Nevada has a reputation for its libertarian laws.

sentence: The Nevada is located almost entirely in the province of the basin and the chain and is divided by numerous north-south mountain ranges.

sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the population of Nevada was 3,080,156 as of July 1, 2019, an increase of 45,764 residents (1.51%) since the 2018 U.S. Census estimate and an increase of 379,605 residents (14.06 per cent) since the 2010 U.S. Census.

sentence: Nevada recorded the highest percentage of population growth between 2017 and 2018.

name: nevada
sentence: Women make up approximately 49.5 per cent of the population.

name: nevada
sentence: Since the 2010 census, the population of Nevada has seen a natural increase of 87,581 (the net difference between 222,508 births and 134,927 deaths) and an increase due to net migration of 146,626 inhabitants (of which 104,032 are due to internal migration and 42,594 are due to international migration).

name: nevada
sentence: The Nevada Population Centre is located in southern Nye County.

sentence: In this county, the unincorporated city of Pahrump, 97 km west of Las Vegas, on the California state line, grew very rapidly from 1980 to 2010.

sentence: At the 2010 census, there were 36,441 residents in the city.

name: nevada
sentence: Las Vegas grew from a mulch of 100 people in 1900 to 10,000 in 1950 to 100,000 in 1970 and was America's fastest growing city and metropolitan area from 1960 to 2000.

name: nevada
sentence: Between the 1940s and 2003, Nevada was the fastest-growing state in the United States.

name: nevada
sentence: Between 1990 and 2000, Nevada's population increased by 66 per cent, while the national population increased by 13 per cent.

name: nevada
sentence: More than two thirds of the population live in Clark County, which is co-extensive with the Las Vegas metropolitan area.

name: nevada
sentence: Thus, in terms of population, Nevada is one of the country's most centralized states.

name: nevada
sentence: Henderson and North Las Vegas are among the fastest growing 20 cities in the United States with more than 100,000 inhabitants.

sentence: According to the 2017 U.S. Community Survey, 28.2% of Nevada's population were of Hispanic or Latin origin (of any race): Mexican (21.4%), Puerto Rican (0.9%), Cuban (1.0%) and other Hispanic or Latin origin (4.8%).

sentence: Americans of English ancestry form pluralities in Lincoln County, Churchill County, Lyon County, White Pine County and Eureka County.

sentence: The city now has one of the most prolific American Asian communities in America, with a predominantly Chinese and Taiwanese region known as "Chinatown" west of the I-15 on Spring Mountain Road.

sentence: The American Filipinos are the largest American Asian group in the state, with a population of over 113,000.

sentence: Mining booms attracted many Greek and Eastern European immigrants to Nevada.

sentence: The indigenous tribes of Nevada are Koso, Paiute, Panamint, Shoshoni, Walapi, Washoe and Ute tribes.

sentence: Mexico (39.5 per cent of immigrants), the Philippines (14.3 per cent), El Salvador (5.2 per cent), China (3.1 per cent) and Cuba (3 per cent) were the main countries of origin of immigrants to Nevada.

sentence: A small percentage of Nevada's population lives in rural areas.

sentence: The culture of these places differs considerably from the larger metropolitan areas.

sentence: The inhabitants of these rural counties tend to be native residents of Nevada, unlike the Las Vegas and Reno regions, where the vast majority of the population was born in another state.

name: nevada
sentence: The rural population is also less diversified in terms of race and ethnicity.

name: nevada
sentence: Ranching also has a long tradition in rural Nevada.

sentence: Church attendance in Nevada is among the weakest of all American states.

sentence: In a 2009 Gallup poll, only 30% of Nevadas reported that they attended the church every week or almost, compared with 42% of all Americans (it was found that only four states had a lower attendance rate than Nevada).

name: nevada
sentence: The main religious affiliations of the Nevada population are: Protestants 35 per cent, no religion 28 per cent, Roman Catholics 25 per cent, Saint of the last days 4 per cent, Jews 2 per cent, Hindus less than 1 per cent, Buddhists 0.5 per cent and Islam less than 0.1 per cent.

name: nevada
sentence: Some parts of Nevada (in the eastern part of the State) are located in the Mormon Corridor.

sentence: The largest denominations by the number of adherents in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church with 451,070; the Church of Jesus Christ of the last days saints with 175,149; and the Southern Baptist Convention with 45,535; Buddhist Congregations 14,727; Baha'i Faith 1,723; and Muslims 1,700.

sentence: The Jewish community is represented by the Rohr and Shabad Jewish Learning Institute.

name: nevada
sentence: Nevada's economy is linked to tourism (especially recreation and gambling), mining and livestock farming.

name: nevada
sentence: Nevada's industrial products are tourism, entertainment, mining, machinery, printing and publishing, food processing and electrical equipment.

sentence: The Economic Analysis Bureau estimates that the total revenue from the state of Nevada in 2018 was $170 billion.

sentence: The Government of Nevada's 2012 debt was calculated as $7.5 billion, or $3,100 per taxpayer.

sentence: In December 2014, the state's unemployment rate was 6.8%.

sentence: Nevada's economy has long been linked to the vice-industries.

sentence: "Nevada was] based on mining and re-founded on sin – starting with the fight against prices and easy divorce a century ago, then extending to gambling and prostitution," said the August 21, 2010 issue of The Economist.

name: nevada
sentence: In some parts of the state outside the metropolitan areas of Las Vegas and Reno, mining plays a major economic role.

name: nevada
sentence: In value, gold is by far the most important ore mined.

name: nevada
sentence: In 2004, 6,800,000 ounces (1900,000,000 g) of gold worth $2.84 billion were extracted in Nevada and the state accounted for 8.7% of world gold production (see Gold Mining in Nevada).

sentence: Other Nevada minerals include construction aggregates, copper, gypsum, diatomite, and lithium.

name: nevada
sentence: Despite its rich deposits, the cost of mining in Nevada is generally high, and production is very sensitive to world commodity prices.

sentence: Cattle farming is a major economic activity in the rural areas of Nevada.

sentence: Nevada's agricultural production is cattle, hay, alfalfa, dairy products, onions and potatoes.

sentence: As of 1 January 2006, there were about 500,000 head of cattle and 70,000 head of sheep in Nevada.

sentence: Most of these animals feed on the routes in summer, with extra food in winter.

sentence: Amtrak's California Zephyr train uses the original Union Pacific transcontinental railway line in daily service from Chicago to Emeryville, California, serving Elko, Winnemucca and Reno.

sentence: The Nevada is also served by several American highways: the United States 6, the United States 50, the United States 93, the United States 95 and the United States 395.

name: nevada
sentence: There are also 189 roads of the state of Nevada.

name: nevada
sentence: RTC Transit is the transit system in the Las Vegas metropolitan area.

sentence: The agency is the largest transit agency in the state and operates a bus network across the Las Vegas Valley, including the use of The Deuce, a two-storey bus, on the Las Vegas Strip and several peripheral roads.

sentence: Other transit systems in the state include Carson City JAC.

sentence: Most other counties in the State do not have public transport at all.

sentence: Several hotels also have their own monorail lines between them, which are usually several blocks in length.

name: nevada
sentence: McCarran International Airport in Las Vegas is the busiest airport in Nevada.

sentence: Nevada has a flourishing solar energy sector.
